NAME="page_os1201_1_20"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="os1201_section_11_plan_administration"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_os1201_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION 11<BR>  <BR>    PLAN ADMINISTRATION    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Principal Sponsor</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.1.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Officers</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as hereinafter provided, functions generally assigned to the
Principal Sponsor shall be discharged by its Compensation and Organization Committee of the Board of Directors of ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc. or delegated and allocated as provided herein. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.1.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Compensation and Organization Committee</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as hereinafter provided, the
Compensation and Organization Committee of the Board of Directors of ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc. may delegate and redelegate and allocate and reallocate to one or more persons or to an
Employer of persons jointly or severally, and whether or not such persons are directors, officers or employees, such functions assigned to the Principal Sponsor hereunder as the Compensation and
Organization Committee of the Board of Directors of ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc. may from time to time deem advisable. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.1.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Board of Directors</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Compensation and
Organization Committee of the Board of Directors of ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc. shall have exclusive authority, which may not be delegated, to act for the Principal Sponsor to terminate this
Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.1.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Amendment</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Principal Sponsor reserves the power to amend this Plan Statement
in any respect and either prospectively or retroactively or both: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>in
any respect by resolution of its Compensation and Organization Committee of the Board of Directors of ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc.; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>in
any respect that does not materially increase the cost of the Plan by action of the Retirement Committee. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conflict of Interest</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If any officer or employee of the Employer or any member of the board of directors of
the Employer to whom authority has been delegated or redelegated hereunder shall also be a Participant in the Plan, the Participant shall have no authority as such officer, employee or member with
respect to any matter specially affecting the Participant's individual interest hereunder (as distinguished from the interests of all Participants and Beneficiaries or a broad class of Participants
and Beneficiaries), all such authority being reserved exclusively to the other officers, employees or members as the case may be, to the exclusion of the Participant and the Participant shall act only
in the Participant's individual capacity in connection with any such material. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Administrator</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Principal Sponsor shall be the administrator for purposes of Section&nbsp;3(16)(A) of
ERISA. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Service of Process</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the absence of any designation to the contrary by the Principal Sponsor, the
Secretary of the Principal Sponsor is designated as the appropriate and exclusive agent for the receipt of service of process directed to the Plan in any legal proceeding, including arbitration,
involving the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>20</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=24,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="5",CHK=383403,FOLIO='20',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]OS1201A.;5',USER='CTAFT',CD='16-JAN-2002;12:50' -->
<A NAME="page_os1201_1_21"> </A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="os1201_section_12_disclaimers"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_os1201_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION 12<BR>  <BR>    DISCLAIMERS    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Term of Employment</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither the terms of the Plan Statement nor the benefits hereunder nor the continuance
thereof shall be a term of the employment of any employee. The Employer shall not be obliged to continue the Plan. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employment</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The terms of the Plan Statement shall not give any employee the right to be retained in the
employment of the Employer. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Source of Payment</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither the Employer nor any of its officers nor any member of its board of directors in
any way secure or guarantee the payment of any benefit or amount which may become due and payable hereunder to any Participant or to any Beneficiary or to any creditor of a Participant or a
Beneficiary. Each Participant, Beneficiary or other person entitled at any time to payments hereunder shall look solely to the assets of the Employer for such payments or to the Accounts distributed
to any Participant or Beneficiary, as the case may be, for such payments. In each case where Accounts shall have been distributed to a former Participant or a Beneficiary or to the person or any one
of a group of persons entitled jointly to the receipt thereof and which purports to cover in full the benefit hereunder, such former Participant or Beneficiary, or such person or persons, as the case
may be, shall have no further right or interest in the other assets of the Employer. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Guaranty</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither the Employer nor any of its officers nor any member of its board of directors shall be
under any liability or responsibility for failure to effect any of the objectives or purposes of the Plan by reason of the insolvency of the Employer. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Delegation</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Employer and its officers and the members of its board of directors shall not be liable for
an act or omission of another person with regard to a responsibility that has been allocated to or delegated to such other person pursuant to the terms of the Plan Statement or pursuant to procedures
set forth in the Plan Statement. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>21</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=25,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="5",CHK=904561,FOLIO='21',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]OS1201A.;5',USER='CTAFT',CD='16-JAN-2002;12:50' -->
<BR>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_ou1201_1_1"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ou1201_appendix_a_change_in_control_special_definitions"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ou1201_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>APPENDIX A<BR>  <BR>    </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>CHANGE IN CONTROL SPECIAL DEFINITIONS    <BR>  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes of Plan Section&nbsp;9.2, the following special definitions shall apply: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Acquiring
Person" shall mean any "person" (as such term is used in Sections 13(d) and 14(d) of the Exchange Act) who or which, together with all Affiliates and Associates of such
person, is the "beneficial owner" (as defined in Rule&nbsp;13d-3 promulgated under the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of securities of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC.
representing 20% or more of the combined voting power of the then outstanding securities of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC., but shall not include ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC., any
subsidiary of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. or any employee benefit plan of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. or of any subsidiary of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. or any entity holding
shares of common stock of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. organized, appointed or established for, or pursuant to the terms of, any such plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Affiliate"
and "Associate" shall have the respective meanings ascribed to such terms in Rule&nbsp;12b-2 promulgated under the Exchange Act. (For purposes of this
Section&nbsp;7.6, "affiliate" shall not have the meaning ascribed to that term in Section&nbsp;1.2.4 of the Plan Statement.)
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Cause"
shall mean willful and continued failure by the employee to perform his duties or gross and willful misconduct including, but not limited to, wrongful appropriation of funds or
the commission of a gross misdemeanor or felony.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Change
in Control" shall mean:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>a
change in control of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. of a nature that would be required to be reported in response to Item 6(e) of Schedule&nbsp;14A of Regulation&nbsp;14A
promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), whether or not ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. is then subject to such reporting requirement;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
public announcement (which, for purposes of this definition, shall include, without limitation, a report filed pursuant to Section&nbsp;13(d) of the Exchange Act) by ADC
TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. or any "person" (as such term is used in Sections 13(d) and 14(d) of the Exchange Act) that such person has become the "beneficial owner" (as defined in
Rule&nbsp;13d-3 promulgated under the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of securities of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. representing 20% or more of the combined voting power of
ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC.'s then outstanding securities, determined in accordance with Rule&nbsp;13d-3, excluding, however, any securities acquired directly from ADC
TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. (other than an acquisition by virtue of the exercise of a conversion privilege unless the security being so converted was itself acquired directly from ADC
TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC.); provided, however, that for purposes of this clause the term "person" shall not include ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC., any subsidiary of ADC
TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. or any employee benefit plan of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. or of any subsidiary of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. or any entity holding shares of common
stock of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. organized, appointed or established for, or pursuant to the terms of, any such plan;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.3</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
Continuing Directors cease to constitute a majority of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC.'s Board of Directors; </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>A-1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=26,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="5",CHK=873896,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]OU1201A.;4',USER='CTAFT',CD='16-JAN-2002;12:50' -->
<A NAME="page_ou1201_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.4</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>consummation
of a reorganization, merger or consolidation of, or a sale or other disposition of all or substantially all of the assets of, ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. (a
"Business Combination"), in each case, unless, following such Business Combination, (A)&nbsp;all or substantially all of the persons who were the beneficial owners of ADC
TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC.'s outstanding voting securities immediately prior to such Business Combination beneficially own voting securities of the corporation resulting from such Business
Combination having more than 50% of the combined voting power of the outstanding voting securities of such resulting corporation and (B)&nbsp;at least a majority of the members of the Board of
Directors of the corporation resulting from such Business Combination were Continuing Directors at the time of the action of the Board of Directors of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. approving
such Business Combination;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.5</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>approval
by the shareholders of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. of a complete liquidation or dissolution of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC.; or
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.6</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
majority of the Continuing Directors determine in their sole and absolute discretion that there has been a change in control of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC.. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Continuing
Director" shall mean any person who is a member of the Board of Directors of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC., while such person is a member of the Board of Directors,
who is not an Acquiring Person or an Affiliate or Associate of an Acquiring Person, or a representative of an
Acquiring Person or of any such Affiliate or Associate, and who (A)&nbsp;was a member of the Board of Directors on September&nbsp;26, 1989, or (B)&nbsp;subsequently becomes a member of the Board
of Directors, if such person's initial nomination for election or initial election to the Board of Directors is recommended or approved by a majority of the Continuing Directors.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Eligible
Participant" shall mean each Participant: (i)&nbsp;who is actively employed on the date of a Change in Control, and (ii)&nbsp;who terminates employment for any reason
(including death) except for Cause during the two (2)&nbsp;years following the date of a Change in Control.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Good
Reason" shall mean the occurrence of any of the following events, except for the occurrence of such an event in connection with the termination or reassignment of the employee's
employment by ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. or any of its subsidiaries for Cause or by reason of disability (as defined in section&nbsp;22(e)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code) or death:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
assignment to the employee of employment responsibilities which are not of comparable responsibility and status as the employment responsibilities held by the employee immediately
prior to a Change in Control;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>a
reduction in the employee's base salary as in effect immediately prior to a Change in Control;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.3</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>an
amendment or modification of the incentive compensation program of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. (except as may be required by applicable law) which affects the terms or
administration of the program in a manner adverse to the interest of the employee as compared to the terms and administration of such program immediately prior to a Change in Control;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.4</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
requirement by ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. or any of its subsidiaries that the employee be based anywhere other than within fifty (50)&nbsp;miles of the employee's
office location immediately prior to a Change in Control, except for requirements of temporary travel on business of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. to an extent substantially consistent with the
employee's business travel obligations immediately prior to a Change in Control; or </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>A-2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=27,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="5",CHK=1013548,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]OU1201A.;4',USER='CTAFT',CD='16-JAN-2002;12:50' -->
<A NAME="page_ou1201_1_3"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.5</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>except
to the extent otherwise required by applicable law, the failure by ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. to continue in effect any benefit or compensation plan, stock ownership
plan, stock purchase plan, bonus plan, life insurance plan, health-and-accident plan or disability plan in which the employee is participating immediately prior to a Change in
Control (or plans providing the employee with substantially similar benefits), the taking of any action by ADC
TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. which would adversely affect the employee's participation in, or materially reduce the employee's benefits under, any of such plans or deprive the employee of any
material fringe benefit enjoyed by the employee immediately prior to such Change in Control, or the failure by ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. to provide the employee with the number of paid
vacation days to which the employee is entitled immediately prior to such Change in Control in accordance with the vacation policy of ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC. as then in effect. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>8</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Maturity
Date" shall mean the eleventh (11th) business day following the date of a Change in Control. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>A-3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=28,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="5",CHK=953834,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]OU1201A.;4',USER='CTAFT',CD='16-JAN-2002;12:50' -->

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="na1201_exhibit_10-u"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_na1201_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10-u    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="na1201_separation_agreement"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_na1201_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>SEPARATION AGREEMENT    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This SEPARATION AGREEMENT, dated as of October&nbsp;22, 2001 (the "Signature Date"), is made and entered into between ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc., a
Minnesota corporation ("ADC"), and Lynn J. Davis, an individual resident of the state of Minnesota ("Davis"). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;BACKGROUND.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Davis
currently is employed by ADC as its President and Chief Operating Officer; and has announced to ADC that he intends to resign from his employment with ADC
on November&nbsp;1, 2001. Davis acknowledges that ADC operates in a highly competitive industry and that the company will enhance its opportunities to succeed by establishing certain rights and
obligations designed to protect ADC's interests following his separation from the company. ADC is willing to provide the consideration set forth in this Agreement in exchange for the performance by
Davis of his undertakings and obligations under this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW
THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual obligations incurred and benefits obtained hereunder, the sufficiency of which are acknowledged, ADC and Davis agree as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Resignation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Davis hereby resigns from his employment as President and Chief Operating Officer of ADC
effective November&nbsp;1, 2001 ("Effective Date"). Davis also hereby resigns from all those positions he holds as an officer, director or other capacity of any affiliate of ADC (collectively, the
"ADC Affiliates") as of the Effective Date. Upon Davis' resignation, ADC will have no further financial obligation to Davis, except as expressly described in this Agreement or as otherwise provided
upon termination of employment under the terms of any ADC deferred compensation, pension or employee welfare benefit plan in which Davis is currently a vested participant. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation and Benefits.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In consideration of the undertakings and covenants on the part of Davis as set
forth in this Agreement, and on condition of Davis' continuing performance of those undertakings and covenants, ADC agrees to provide the following compensation and benefits: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.01</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Base Salary.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Davis shall continue to receive base salary at his current level in accordance with ADC's
normal payroll procedures and policies through the Effective Date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.02</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Incentive Compensation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Davis acknowledges that no incentive compensation has been earned or is otherwise
payable to him under the terms of the ADC Management Incentive Plan ("MIP"). </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.03</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Post-Separation Medical Benefits.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Following the Effective Date, ADC will provide Davis with
continuing medical benefits as follows: Upon his election of COBRA continuation coverage, ADC shall continue to pay an amount equal to the current employer contribution to medical benefits premiums
until such time as (a)&nbsp;Davis first becomes covered by another group medical coverage; (b)&nbsp;the termination of the COBRA continuation period; or (c)&nbsp;April&nbsp;30, 2003, whichever
is earlier. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.04</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Severance Payments.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ADC shall pay to Davis a total of One Million Dollars ($1,000,000.00), payable in
twenty-four (24)&nbsp;equal monthly installments commencing on November&nbsp;30, 2001, subject to all applicable withholding for taxes. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.05</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stock Options Grant.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ADC will recommend to the Compensation and Organization Committee of the Board of
Directors that as of the Effective Date, an option be granted to Davis to purchase one hundred fifty thousand (150,000) shares of ADC's common stock, subject to and in accordance with the terms of the
ADC 1991 Stock Incentive Plan (the "Plan") and a Nonqualified Stock Option Agreement (the "Option Agreement") to be entered into by Davis and ADC, in the form attached hereto as Exhibit&nbsp;A. Such
option would have an exercise price per share equal to the fair market value of ADC Common Stock on November&nbsp;1, 2001 as determined in accordance with the Plan. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="6",CHK=387429,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]NA1201A.;11',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:47' -->
<A NAME="page_na1201_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Confidential Information/Intellectual Property.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As a condition precedent to ADC performing its obligations
hereunder, Davis shall execute and deliver to ADC the Employee Confidentiality, Invention, Copyright and Trade Secret Agreement in the form attached hereto as Exhibit&nbsp;B (the "Employee Invention
Agreement") on or prior to the Effective Date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Surrender of Records and Property.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On or prior to the Effective Date, Davis shall deliver promptly to ADC his
ADC facilities access card, SecurID Net Access card, and all records, manuals, books, blank forms, documents, letters, memoranda, notes, notebooks, reports, computers, computer disks, computer
software, computer programs (including source code, object code, on-line files, documentation, testing materials and plans and reports), designs, drawings, formulae, data, tables or
calculations or copies thereof, which are the property of ADC or any ADC Affiliate or which relate in any way to the business, products, practices or techniques of ADC or any ADC Affiliate, and all
other property, trade secrets and confidential information of ADC or any ADC Affiliate, including, but not limited to, all tangible, written, graphical, machine readable and other materials (including
all copies) which in whole or in part contain any trade secrets or confidential information of ADC or any ADC Affiliate which in any of these cases are in Davis' possession or under his control. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Noncompetition, Nonsolicitation and Nondisparagement.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In consideration of the financial and other benefits to
be provided by ADC, and as a condition of ADC's obligations hereunder, Davis agrees as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.01</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Agreement Not to Compete.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the "Covered Period" (as defined below), Davis shall not, directly or
indirectly, engage in any "Competing Business Activity" (as defined below), in any manner or capacity ( </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>e.g.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, as an advisor, principal, agent, partner, officer, director, investor, shareholder,
employee, member of any association or otherwise) without the prior written consent of
ADC's Chief Executive Officer. As used in this Agreement, "Covered Period" shall mean the period commencing on the Signature Date of this Agreement and ending November&nbsp;1, 2003. As used in this
Agreement, "Competing Business Activity" shall mean the development, manufacture, sale, distribution or delivery (whether directly to the end customer or to third parties) of copper or fiber
connectivity, IP cable, photonic, digital wireless, DSL or other wireline access components, systems or equipment or software or systems integration services which enable communications service
providers to deliver communications services including high-speed Internet, data, video and voice services to consumers and businesses. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.02</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Geographical Extent of Covenant.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Davis acknowledges that ADC directly, or indirectly through ADC
Affiliates, currently is engaged in business on a worldwide basis. Consequently, Davis agrees that his obligations under this Section&nbsp;5 to refrain from any Competing Business Activity during
the Covered Period shall apply in any market, foreign or domestic, in which: (a)&nbsp;ADC or, as applicable, an ADC Affiliate(s), operates during the term of the Covered Period; and (b)&nbsp;ADC
or, as applicable, an ADC Affiliate(s), has plans to enter as of the Effective Date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.03</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Non-hire; Nonsolicitation; and Noninterference.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the Covered Period, Davis shall not
directly or indirectly, or through the actions of any third party: (a)&nbsp;induce or attempt to induce any employee of ADC or any ADC Affiliate to leave the employ of ADC or such ADC Affiliate, or
in any way interfere adversely with the relationship between any such employee and ADC or such ADC Affiliate; (b)&nbsp;induce or attempt to induce any employee of ADC or any ADC Affiliate to work
for, render services to, provide advice to, or supply confidential business information or trade secrets of ADC or any ADC Affiliate to any third person, firm or corporation; (c)&nbsp;employ, or
otherwise pay for services rendered by, any employee of ADC or any ADC Affiliate in any business enterprise with which Davis may be associated, connected or affiliated in any manner; or
(d)&nbsp;induce or attempt to induce any customer,
supplier, licensee, licensor or other business relation of ADC or any ADC Affiliate to cease doing business with ADC or such ADC Affiliate, or in any </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="6",CHK=410645,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]NA1201A.;11',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:47' -->
<A NAME="page_na1201_1_3"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
way interfere with the relationship between any such customer, supplier, licensee, licensor or other business relation and ADC or such ADC Affiliate. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.04</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Nondisparagement.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Davis agrees that he will not make any remarks (whether in public or private) disparaging
of ADC or any ADC affiliates, or their respective products, services, officers, directors, or employees, whether past or current. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consideration and Remedy for Breach.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.01</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adequate Consideration.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Davis acknowledges and agrees that the benefits and compensation that ADC has
agreed to provide to him pursuant to this Agreement are adequate consideration for Davis' agreement to undertake all of the obligations and duties specified in this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.02</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Remedies for Breach.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;It is understood and agreed that, in the event of any breach of the undertakings and
obligations set forth in this Agreement by Davis, and in addition to any other legal remedies which may be available to it, ADC shall be entitled to: (a)&nbsp;refrain from making any further
payments which might otherwise be due to Davis under the terms of this Agreement and to void any options granted pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.05 above which remain unvested at the time of such breach,
and (b)&nbsp;to recover from Davis all amounts previously paid to him under the provisions of this Agreement. Davis acknowledges that immediate and irreparable harm will result to ADC and/or the ADC
affiliates in the event of his breach of the terms of Section&nbsp;5 of this Agreement and that it would be difficult to compensate ADC and/or the ADC affiliates fully for all damages which they may
incur as a result of any violation of these provisions. Accordingly, Davis specifically agrees that ADC and/or the ADC affiliates will be entitled to temporary and permanent injunctive relief to
enforce the provisions of Section&nbsp;5 of the Agreement and to restrain any violations thereof by Davis and/or his partners, agents, employers, employees, or other persons acting for or on behalf
of him, and that such relief may be granted without the necessity of proving actual damages. The right of ADC and/or the ADC affiliates to obtain injunctive relief will not diminish in any way their
right to claim and recover damages in addition to injunctive relief. It is further agreed, however, that in the event that any provisions set forth in Section&nbsp;5 of the Agreement are determined
in any court proceedings to be overbroad or unreasonably restrictive in any respect, then these provisions shall nevertheless be enforced in all respects and to such extent as may be deemed by the
court to be reasonable. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Release of Claims.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.01</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General Release.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;By this Agreement, ADC and Davis also intend to settle any and all claims Davis has or may
have against ADC as the result of Davis' employment with ADC, as well as Davis'
contemplated separation from employment as of the Effective Date. In exchange for the consideration expressed here, Davis hereby completely releases and waives any and all claims, complaints, causes
of action, demands, suits, and damages, of any kind or character, which he has or may have against ADC and/or its employees, agents, officers, directors, counsel, predecessors, successors,
subsidiaries, affiliates, assigns, and insurers and each and all thereof (collectively, the "Released Parties"), arising out of any acts, omissions, statements, conduct, decisions, behavior, or events
occurring on or prior to the Signature Date, including his contemplated separation from employment as of the Effective Date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Davis
understands and accepts that his release of claims includes, but is not limited to, claims based upon: Title VII of the Federal Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended; the Americans
with Disabilities Act; the Equal Pay Act; the Fair Labor Standards Act; the Employee Retirement Income Security Act; the Age Discrimination in Employment Act; the Minnesota Human Rights Act; or any
other federal, state or local statute, ordinance or law. Davis also understands that he is giving up all other claims, whether grounded in contract or tort theories, including but not limited </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="6",CHK=127510,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]NA1201A.;11',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:47' -->
<A NAME="page_na1201_1_4"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
to: wrongful discharge; violation of Minn. Stat. &sect;176.82; breach of contract; tortious interference with contractual relations; promissory estoppel; breach of the implied covenant of good
faith and fair dealing; breach of express or implied promise; breach of manuals or other policies; breach of fiduciary duty; assault; battery; fraud; false imprisonment; invasion of privacy;
intentional or negligent misrepresentation; defamation, including libel, slander, discharge defamation and self-publication defamation; discharge in violation of public policy;
whistleblower; intentional or negligent infliction of emotional distress; or any other theory, whether legal or equitable. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Davis
further understands that he is releasing, and does hereby release, any claims for damages, by charge or otherwise, whether brought by him or on his behalf by any other party,
governmental or otherwise, and agrees not to institute any claims for damages via administrative or legal proceedings against any of the Released Parties. Davis also waives and releases any and all
rights to money damages or other legal relief awarded by any governmental agency related to any charge or other claim. Davis and ADC agree that, by signing this Agreement, Davis does not waive any
claims arising after the Signature Date, except for any claims with respect to his contemplated separation from employment as of the Effective Date. It is further agreed that this release does not
include Davis' rights under this Agreement itself or any rights that may be provided on termination of employment under the terms of any ADC deferred compensation, pension or employee welfare benefit
plan in which Davis is currently a vested participant, nor does it include his present rights to indemnity under the by-laws of ADC and applicable law, which indemnification rights are
expressly reaffirmed. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.02</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Right to Revoke and Rescind.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Davis has been informed of his right to revoke this Agreement insofar as it
extends to potential claims under the Age Discrimination in Employment Act by informing ADC of his intent to revoke this Agreement within seven (7)&nbsp;calendar days following his date of execution
of this Agreement. Davis has likewise been informed of his right to rescind this release insofar as it extends to his release of claims under the Minnesota Human Rights Act (MHRA) by delivering a
written rescission to ADC within fifteen (15)&nbsp;days after signing this Agreement. In either case, Davis must deliver any such revocation by hand within the applicable period or send it by
certified mail within the applicable period to Laura Owen, Vice President&#151;Human Resources, ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc., P.O.&nbsp;Box 1101, Minneapolis, MN
55440-1101. If Davis exercises such right to revoke, ADC may at its option either nullify this Agreement, or keep it in effect in all respects other
than as to Davis' release of claims that he has revoked. If ADC chooses to nullify this Agreement, neither Davis nor ADC shall have any rights or obligations under it. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Davis
has also been informed that the terms of this Agreement will remain open for acceptance and execution by him for a period of twenty-one (21)&nbsp;days during which
time he may consult with legal counsel or other advisors of his choice and consider whether to accept this Agreement. No payments or benefits of any kind pursuant to this Agreement shall become due to
Davis until he has executed this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.03</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Release of Claims Through Effective Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In exchange for the consideration expressed in this Agreement and
as a condition thereof, Davis further agrees that immediately upon his resignation from employment on November&nbsp;1, 2001, he will execute a General Release of Claims in the form attached hereto
as Exhibit&nbsp;C (the "Effective Date Release"), extending to any and all claims arising on or prior to the Effective Date. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Miscellaneous.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.01</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Governing Law and Venue Selection.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement is made under and shall be governed by and construed in
accordance with the laws of the State of Minnesota, without regard to conflicts of laws principles thereof, or those of any other state of the United States of America, or of any other country,
province or city. The parties agree that any litigation in any way relating </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=4,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="6",CHK=474360,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]NA1201A.;11',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:47' -->
<A NAME="page_na1201_1_5"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
to this Agreement, including but not limited to any action brought pursuant to Section&nbsp;6, will be venued in the State of Minnesota, Hennepin County District Court, or the United States
District Court for the District of Minnesota. Davis and ADC hereby consent to the personal jurisdiction of these courts and waive any objection that such venue is inconvenient or improper. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.02</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior Agreements.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement (including other agreements specifically mentioned in this Agreement)
contains the entire understanding of the parties relating to the employment of Davis by ADC, Davis' separation from such employment, and the other matters discussed herein, and supersedes all prior
proposals, promises, contracts, agreements and understandings of any kind, whether express or implied, oral or written, with respect to such subject matter (including, but not limited to, any
proposal, promise, contract, agreement or understanding, whether express or implied, oral or written, by and between ADC and Davis), and the parties hereto have made no agreements, representations or
warranties relating to the subject matter of this Agreement which are not set forth herein or in the other agreements mentioned herein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.03</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Withholding Taxes.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ADC may take such action as it deems appropriate to insure that all applicable federal,
state, city and other payroll, withholding, income or other taxes ("Taxes") arising from any
compensation, benefits or any other payments made pursuant to this Agreement are withheld or collected from Davis. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.04</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amendments.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No amendment or modification of this Agreement shall be deemed effective unless made in writing
and signed by Davis and ADC. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.05</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No Waiver.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No term or condition of this Agreement shall be deemed to have been waived, nor shall there be
any estoppel to enforce any provisions of this Agreement, except by a statement in writing signed by the party against whom enforcement of the waiver or estoppel is sought. Any written waiver shall
not be deemed a continuing waiver unless specifically stated, shall operate only as to the specific term or condition waived, and shall not constitute a waiver of such term or condition for the future
or as to any act other than as specifically set forth in the waiver. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.06</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignment, Successors.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement shall not be assignable, in whole or in part, by any party without
the written consent of the other party, except that ADC may, without the consent of Davis, assign its rights and obligations under this Agreement to any ADC Affiliate or to any corporation, firm or
other business entity with or into which ADC may merge or consolidate, or to which ADC may sell or transfer all or substantially all of its assets, or of which 50% or more of the equity investment and
of the voting control is owned, directly or indirectly, by, or is under common ownership with, ADC. After any such assignment by ADC, ADC shall be discharged from all further liability hereunder and
such assignee shall thereafter be deemed to be ADC for the purposes of all provisions of this Agreement. Both the rights and the obligations of ADC under this Agreement shall inure to the benefit of,
and be binding upon, the successors (by purchase, merger, consolidation, or otherwise) and assigns of ADC. In the event that Davis dies before all monetary payments due to him under
Section&nbsp;2.04 of this Agreement have been made, then all such payments shall continue to be made to the estate of Davis. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.07</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Severability.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To the extent any provision of this Agreement shall be determined to be invalid or
unenforceable in any jurisdiction, such provision shall be deemed to be deleted from this Agreement as to such jurisdiction only, and the validity and enforceability of the remainder of such provision
and of this Agreement shall be unaffected. In furtherance of and not in limitation of the foregoing, Davis expressly agrees that should the duration of, geographical extent of, or business activities
covered by Section&nbsp;5 of this Agreement be in excess of that which is valid or enforceable under applicable law in a given jurisdiction, then such provision, as to such jurisdiction only, shall
be construed to cover only that duration, extent or activities that may validly or enforceably be covered. Davis acknowledges the uncertainty of the law in this respect and expressly stipulates that
this Agreement shall be construed in a manner that renders its provisions valid and enforceable to </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=5,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="6",CHK=251388,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]NA1201A.;11',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:47' -->
<A NAME="page_na1201_1_6"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
the maximum extent (not exceeding its express terms) possible under applicable law in each applicable jurisdiction. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.08</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Press Release.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Davis acknowledges and agrees that ADC will issue a press release or other statements with
respect to Davis' resignation from employment following the Signature Date. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the date set forth in the first paragraph. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A

<A NAME="toc_nb1201_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Oral Agreement Regarding Health Insurance Coverage    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Oral Agreement, effective as of November&nbsp;16, 2001, between ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc. ("ADC") and Peter W. Hemp ("Hemp"). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
connection with Hemp's retirement from ADC on November&nbsp;16, 2001, ADC agreed to pay the employer portion of Hemp's COBRA medical and dental insurance coverage for one calendar
month following his termination of employment, through December&nbsp;31, 2001. ADC's total costs for such coverage total $490.75, as follows: </FONT></P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.BB
<SEQUENCE>9
<FILENAME>a2067550zex-10_bb.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10-BB
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE> Prepared by MERRILL CORPORATION
</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#02STP1201_8">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.bb  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ki1201_first_amendment_to_participation_agreement"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ki1201_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>FIRST AMENDMENT TO<BR>  PARTICIPATION AGREEMENT    <BR></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS
FIRST AMENDMENT TO PARTICIPATION AGREEMENT, dated as of January&nbsp;29, 2001 (this " </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Amendment  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), amends the Participation Agreement, dated as of October&nbsp;22, 1999 (the " </FONT> <FONT
SIZE=2><I>Participation Agreement  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), by and among ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc., a Minnesota corporation, as Lessee; Lease Plan North America,&nbsp;Inc., not in its individual capacity, except as
expressly stated therein, but solely as Agent Lessor for the Participants; the Persons named on Schedule&nbsp;I thereto, as Participants; and ABN AMRO Bank N.V., as Administrative Agent. Capitalized
terms used herein and not otherwise defined herein shall have the respective meanings assigned thereto in Appendix&nbsp;1 to the Participation Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
the parties hereto have entered into the Participation Agreement and the other Operative Documents to fund the Construction of the Financed Improvements on the Land; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
the parties hereto desire to amend the Participation Agreement as hereinafter set forth; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW,
THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and for other good and valuable consideration (the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged), the parties hereto agree as
follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
1 AMENDMENTS. Effective as of the date hereof and subject to the satisfaction of the condition precedent set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;2  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Participation Agreement shall be amended in accordance with
</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Sections&nbsp;1.1-1.6  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
1.1 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>ERISA Compliance  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Section&nbsp;7.2(l)(iii)&nbsp;of the Participation Agreement is hereby amended and restated in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"(iii)&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;No
ERISA Event has occurred or is reasonably expected to occur; (B)&nbsp;no Pension Plan has an Unfunded Pension Liability with an aggregate liability amount thereunder in
excess of $5,000,000; (C)&nbsp;neither Lessee nor any ERISA Affiliate has incurred, or reasonably expects to incur, any liability under Title IV of ERISA with respect to any Pension Plan (other than
premiums due and not delinquent under Section&nbsp;4007 of ERISA) in an aggregate liability amount thereunder in excess of $5,000,000; (D)&nbsp;neither Lessee nor any ERISA Affiliate has incurred,
or reasonably expects to incur, any liability (and no event has occurred which, with the giving of notice under Section&nbsp;4219 of ERISA, would result in such liability) under Section&nbsp;4201
or 4243 of ERISA with respect to a Multiemployer Plan in an aggregate amount thereunder in excess of $5,000,000; and (E)&nbsp;neither Lessee nor any ERISA Affiliate has engaged in a transaction that
could be subject to Section&nbsp;4069 or 4212(c) of ERISA." </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
1.2 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Covenants of Lessee  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Section&nbsp;8.1(i)(v)(F)(C) of the Participation Agreement is hereby amended and restated in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"(C)
the adoption of, or the commencement of contributions to, any Plan subject to Section&nbsp;412 of the Code by Lessee or any ERISA Affiliate if such adoption results in a material increase in
contributions or Unfunded Pension Liability; or" </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
1.3 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Limitation on Liens  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Section&nbsp;8.2(l) of the Participation Agreement is hereby amended and restated in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"(l)
other Liens not of the type described in the foregoing clauses (a)&nbsp;through (k); provided, that (i)&nbsp;both before and after giving effect to the creation of such Lien no Default or
Event of Default shall have occurred and be continuing and (ii)&nbsp;the aggregate amount of Indebtedness and/or other liabilities secured by such Liens when combined with the aggregate principal
amount of obligations owed by Lessee and its Subsidiaries under Sale and Leaseback Transactions shall at no time exceed $50,000,000." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="8",CHK=267353,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]KI1201A.;11',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:45' -->
<A NAME="page_ki1201_1_2"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
1.4 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Limitation on Indebtedness  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Section&nbsp;8.6(d) of the Participation Agreement is hereby amended by deleting the reference to "$25,000,000" appearing therein and replacing it with a reference to
"$50,000,000". </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
1.5 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Lease Obligations  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Section&nbsp;8.10 of the Participation Agreement is hereby amended by (a)&nbsp;deleting the word "and" at the end of clause&nbsp;(b) thereof, (b)&nbsp;changing the
reference to clause&nbsp;(c) thereof to clause&nbsp;(d), and (c)&nbsp;adding the following new clause&nbsp;(c) immediately after clause&nbsp;(b) thereof: </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"(c)
Sale and Leaseback Transactions; and". </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
1.6 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Sale and Leaseback Transactions  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Appendix&nbsp;1 to the Participation Agreement is hereby amended by adding thereto the following new defined term "Sale and Leaseback Transaction" in proper
alphabetical
order: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"'
</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Sale and Leaseback Transaction  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>' means any arrangement with any bank, insurance company or other lender or investor (not including Lessee or any Subsidiary) to which any such lender or investor is a
party,
providing for the leasing by Lessee or a Subsidiary under an operating lease of any property which has been or is to be sold or transferred by Lessee or such Subsidiary to such lender or investor or
to any Person to whom funds have been or are to be advanced by such lender or investor on the security of such property if (a)&nbsp;Lessee or such Subsidiary would be permitted to create
Indebtedness secured by a Lien pursuant to the terms of Section&nbsp;8.2 on the property to be leased in an amount equal to the proceeds with respect to such Sale and Leaseback Transaction; and
(b)&nbsp;Lessee or such Subsidiary would be permitted to dispose of such property pursuant to the terms of Section&nbsp;8.3." </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
2 CONDITION PRECEDENT. This Amendment shall become effective as of the date hereof when the Agent Lessor shall have received this Amendment, duly executed by each of the parties
hereto. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
3 REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES. Each of the parties hereto hereby represents and warrants that (a)&nbsp;the execution, delivery and performance of this Amendment has been
duly authorized by such party, (b)&nbsp;the person executing this Amendment on its behalf has been duly authorized to act on its behalf, (c)&nbsp;this Amendment constitutes its legal, valid,
binding and enforceable agreement, except as enforceability may be limited by bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium or other laws or equitable principles relating to or limiting the
rights of creditors generally and (d)&nbsp;its entry into this Amendment will not violate any agreement, law, rule or regulation by which it is bound or by which any of its assets are affected. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
4 MISCELLANEOUS. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
4.1 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Continuing Effectiveness, etc  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. This Amendment shall be deemed to be an amendment to the Participation Agreement, and the Participation Agreement, as amended hereby, and each other Operative
Document, shall
remain in full force and effect and are hereby ratified, approved and confirmed in each and every respect. On and after the date hereof, all references to the "Participation Agreement" in the
Operative Documents or in any other document, instrument, certificate, agreement, opinion or writing shall be deemed to refer to the Participation Agreement as amended hereby. Except as expressly set
forth herein, the execution, delivery and effectiveness of this Amendment shall not operate as an amendment, modification or waiver of any provision, right, power or remedy of any party hereto under
any Operative Document. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
4.2 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Severability  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Any provision of this Amendment which is prohibited or unenforceable in any jurisdiction shall, as to such provision and such jurisdiction, be ineffective to the extent of
such prohibition or unenforceability without invalidating the remaining provisions of this Amendment or affecting the validity or enforceability of such provision in any other jurisdiction. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="8",CHK=711961,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]KI1201A.;11',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:45' -->
<A NAME="page_ki1201_1_3"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
4.3 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Headings  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. The various headings of this Amendment are inserted for convenience of reference only and shall not affect the meaning or interpretation of this Amendment or any provisions
hereof. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
4.4 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Execution in Counterparts  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. This Amendment may be executed by the parties hereto in several counterparts, each of which shall be deemed to be an original and all of which shall constitute together
but
one and the same agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
4.5 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Governing Law.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THIS AMENDMENT SHALL IN ALL RESPECTS BE GOVERNED BY THE INTERNAL LAW OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK AS TO ALL MATTERS OF CONSTRUCTION, VALIDITY AND PERFORMANCE, WITHOUT REGARD TO
CONFLICTS OF LAW PRINCIPLES, EXCEPT TITLE 14 OF ARTICLE 5 OF THE NEW YORK GENERAL OBLIGATIONS LAW.  </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> This Amendment constitutes the entire understanding among the parties hereto with respect to the subject matter hereof and
supersedes any prior agreement, written or oral,
with respect thereto. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
4.6 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Successors and Assigns  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. This Amendment shall be binding upon and shall inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their respective successors and assigns. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[SIGNATURE
PAGES FOLLOW] </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_kj1201_1_1"> </A> </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have caused this Amendment to be executed by their respective officers thereunto duly authorized as of the day and year first above written. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="46%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
