<A NAME="page_lf1201_1_4"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Original Balance"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, with respect to any Receivable coming into existence after the Initial Cutoff Date, the Outstanding
Balance of such Receivable on the date it was created. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Originator"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in the preamble to the Agreement. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Originator Agent"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in the preamble to the Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"PBGC"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation, or any successor thereto. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Pension Plan"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means a pension plan (as defined in Section&nbsp;3(2) of ERISA) subject to Title IV of ERISA which Originator sponsors or maintains, or to which it makes, is making, or is
obligated to make contributions, or in the case of a multiple employer plan (as described in Section&nbsp;4064(a) of ERISA) has made contributions at any time during the immediately preceding five
plan years. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Plan"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an employee benefit plan (as defined in Section&nbsp;3(3) of ERISA) which Originator Agent sponsors or maintains or
to which Originator Agent makes, is making, or is
obligated to make contributions and includes any Pension Plan, other than a Plan maintained outside the United States primarily for the benefit of Persons who are not U.S. residents. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Purchase"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the purchase pursuant to </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.2(a)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;of the Agreement by Buyer from Originator of the Receivables and the Related
Security and Collections related thereto, together with all related rights in
connection therewith. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Purchase Agreement"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in the Preliminary Statements to the Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Purchase Price"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, with respect to the Purchase, the aggregate price to be paid by Buyer to Originator Agent, for the benefit of Originator, in accordance with </FONT> <FONT
SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.3  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;of the Agreement for the Receivables, Collections and Related Security being sold to Buyer, which
price shall equal on any date (i)&nbsp;the product of (x)&nbsp;the Outstanding Balance of such Receivables on such date, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>multiplied by  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (y)&nbsp;one minus the Discount Factor in effect on such
date, minus (ii)&nbsp;any Purchase Price Credits to be credited against the Purchase Price otherwise payable in
accordance with </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.4  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;of the Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Purchase Price Credit"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.4  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;of the Agreement. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Purchase Report"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.2(b)  </I></FONT><FONT
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;of the Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Receivable"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means all indebtedness and other obligations owed by any Domestic Person to Originator (at the times it arises, and before giving effect to any transfer or conveyance under
the Agreement) or to Buyer (after giving effect to the transfers under the Agreement) or in which Originator or Buyer has a security interest or other interest, including, without limitation, any
indebtedness, obligation or interest constituting an account, chattel paper, instrument or general intangible, arising in connection with the sale of goods or the rendering of services by Originator,
and further includes, without limitation, the obligation to pay any Finance Charges with respect thereto. Indebtedness and other rights and obligations arising from any one transaction, including,
without limitation, indebtedness and other rights and obligations represented by an individual invoice, shall constitute a Receivable separate from a Receivable consisting of the indebtedness and
other rights and obligations arising from any other transaction; </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>further  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that any indebtedness, rights or obligations
referred to in the immediately preceding sentence shall be a Receivable regardless or whether the account debtor or Originator
treats such indebtedness, rights or obligations as a separate payment obligation. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Related Security"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, with respect to any Receivable: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
of Originator's remaining interest (if any) in the inventory and goods (including returned or repossessed inventory or goods), the sale of which by Originator gave
rise to such Receivable, and all insurance contracts with respect thereto, </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=28,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="13",CHK=599909,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LF1201A.;7',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_lf1201_1_5"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
other security interests or liens and property subject thereto from time to time, if any, purporting to secure payment of such Receivable, whether pursuant to the
Contract related to such Receivable or otherwise, together with all financing statements and security agreements describing any collateral securing such Receivable, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
guaranties, letters of credit, insurance and other agreements or arrangements of whatever character from time to time supporting or securing payment of such
Receivable whether pursuant to the Contract related to such Receivable or otherwise, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
service contracts and other contracts and agreements associated with such Receivable, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
Records related to such Receivable, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
of Originator's right, title and interest in each Lock-Box and each Collection Account, and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vii)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
proceeds of any of the foregoing. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Reportable Event"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means any of the events set forth in Section&nbsp;4043(c) of ERISA or the regulations thereunder, other than any such event for which the 30-day notice
requirement under ERISA has been waived in regulations issued by the PBGC. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Required Capital Amount"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, as of any date of determination, an amount in cash, assets or a mixture of both (including Initial Contributed Receivables) equal to the greater of (a)&nbsp;3% of the
Purchase Limit under the Purchase Agreement, and (b)&nbsp;the product of (i)&nbsp;1.5 times the product of the Default Ratio times the Default Horizon Ratio </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>,  </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> each as determined from the most recent
Monthly Report received from the Servicer under the Purchase Agreement, and (ii)&nbsp;the Outstanding Balance of all Receivables as
of such date, as determined from the most recent Monthly Report received from the Servicer under the Purchase Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"S&amp;P"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means Standard and Poor's Ratings Services, a division of The McGraw Hill Companies,&nbsp;Inc. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Settlement Date"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, with respect to each Calculation Period, the date that is the calendar day of the month following such Calculation Period specified in the First Amendment. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Subordinated Loan"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.3(a)  </I></FONT><FONT
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;of the Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Subordinated Note"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means a promissory note in substantially the form of </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;VI  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;hereto as more fully described in </FONT> <FONT
SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.3  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;of the Agreement, as the same may be amended, restated, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Tax Code"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as the same may be amended from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Termination Date"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the earliest to occur of (i)&nbsp;the Facility Termination Date (as defined in the Purchase Agreement), (ii)&nbsp;the Business Day immediately prior to the
occurrence of a Termination Event set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;5.1(d)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, (iii)&nbsp;the Business Day specified in a written notice from Buyer to Originator following the occurrence of any other Termination
Event, and (iv)&nbsp;the date which
is 5 Business Days after Buyer's receipt of written notice from Originator that it wishes to terminate the facility evidenced by this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Termination Event"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;5.1  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;of
the Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Transaction Documents"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, collectively, this Agreement, each Collection Account Agreement, the Subordinated Note, and all other instruments, documents and agreements executed and delivered in
connection herewith. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=29,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="13",CHK=295981,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LF1201B.;9',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_lf1201_1_6"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Unmatured Termination Event"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an event which, with the passage of time or the giving of notice, or both, would constitute a Termination Event. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>All accounting terms not specifically defined herein shall be construed in accordance with GAAP. All terms used in Article&nbsp;9 of the UCC in the State of New York, and not
specifically defined herein, are used herein as defined in such Article&nbsp;9.  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<TYPE>EX-10.HH
<SEQUENCE>15
<FILENAME>a2067550zex-10_hh.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10-HH
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE> Prepared by MERRILL CORPORATION
</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#02STP1201_14">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10-hh  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="li1201_first_amendment_to_receivables_sale_agreement"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_li1201_1"> </A></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>FIRST AMENDMENT TO RECEIVABLES SALE AGREEMENT    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>THIS FIRST AMENDMENT TO RECEIVABLES SALE AGREEMENT,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> dated as of December&nbsp;21, 2001 (this </FONT> <FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>"Amendment"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), is by and among ADC Telecommunications Sales,&nbsp;Inc. (the " </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Originator  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc. (the " </FONT> <FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Originator Agent  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") and ADC Receivables Corp. I ( </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Buyer"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), and pertains to the Receivables Sale Agreement dated as of December&nbsp;12, 2001 amongst
the parties hereto (the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Agreement"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>).
</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Unless otherwise defined in this Amendment shall have the meanings assigned to such terms in the Agreement or in the Purchase Agreement described therein.  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>PRELIMINARY STATEMENTS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>WHEREAS,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the Buyer, Originator Agent and the Originator wish to amend the Agreement as set forth herein; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>WHEREAS,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the Agent, on behalf of Blue Ridge under the Purchase Agreement, is willing to consent to such amendment. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>NOW, THEREFORE,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> in consideration of the foregoing premises and the mutual agreements herein contained and other
good and valuable consideration, the receipt and adequacy of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amendments.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.1
of the Agreement is amended and restated in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Initial Contribution of Receivables.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On December&nbsp;21, 2001 (the " </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Initial Sale Date  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), Originator does
hereby contribute, assign, transfer, set-over and otherwise convey to Buyer, and Buyer does hereby accept from Originator, Receivables
originated by Originator and existing as of the close of business on the Business Day immediately prior to the Initial Sale Date (the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Initial Cutoff Date"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) having an aggregate Outstanding
Balance of $250,000 (the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Initial Contributed Receivables"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), together with all Related Security relating thereto and all Collections thereof. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;Exhibit&nbsp;I
to the Agreement is hereby amended by amending in their entirety the following definitions appearing therein: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Discount Factor"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means a percentage calculated to provide Buyer with a reasonable return on its investment in the Receivables after taking account of (i)&nbsp;the time value of money based
upon the anticipated dates of collection of the Receivables and the cost to Buyer of financing its investment in the Receivables during such period and (ii)&nbsp;the risk of nonpayment by the
Obligors. Originator and Buyer may agree from time to time to change the Discount Factor based on changes in one or more of the items affecting the calculation thereof, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided that  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> any change
to the Discount Factor shall take effect as of the commencement of a Calculation Period, shall apply only prospectively and shall not affect the Purchase Price
payment made prior to the Calculation Period during which Originator and Buyer agree to make such change. As of the date of the First Amendment, the Discount Factor in respect of Eligible Receivables
and all other Receivables is equal to a percentage specified in the Second Amendment. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Settlement Date"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, with respect to each Calculation Period, the date that is the 17<SUP>th</SUP> day of the month following such Calculation Period. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;Exhibit&nbsp;I
to the Agreement is hereby amended by addition the following definition: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Second Amendment"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an amendment to this Agreement mutually agreed upon by the parties hereto. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="14",CHK=198366,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LI1201A.;16',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_li1201_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Representations and Warranties.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to induce the other parties hereto to enter into this Amendment,
each of the Buyer and the Originators hereby represents and warrants to each of the other parties hereto as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;The
execution and delivery by such party of this Amendment, and the performance of its obligations under the Agreement as amended hereby, are within such party's
organizational powers and authority and have been duly authorized by all necessary organizational action on its part; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;This
Amendment has been duly executed and delivered by such party, and the Agreement, as amended hereby, constitutes such party's legal, valid and binding obligation,
enforceable against such party in accordance with its terms, except as such enforcement may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization or other similar laws relating to or
limiting creditors' rights generally and by general principles of equity (regardless of whether enforcement is sought in a proceeding in equity or at law), and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;As
of the date hereof, no event has occurred and is continuing that will constitute a Termination Event or an Unmatured Termination Event. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conditions Precedent.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Amendment shall become effective as of the date first above written upon execution
and delivery of a counterpart hereof by each of the Originator, the Originator Agent, the Buyer and the Agent. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Miscellaneous.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CHOICE OF LAW.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS AMENDMENT SHALL BE GOVERNED AND CONSTRUED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE INTERNAL LAWS (AND NOT
THE LAW OF CONFLICTS) OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Counterparts.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Amendment may be executed in any number of counterparts and by different parties hereto
in separate counterparts, each of which when so executed shall be deemed to be an original and all of which when taken together shall constitute one and the same agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ratification of Agreement.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as expressly amended hereby, the Agreement remains unaltered and in full
force and effect and is hereby ratified and confirmed. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><I>&lt;signature pages follow&gt;  </I></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>IN WITNESS WHEREOF,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the parties hereto have caused this Amendment to be executed and delivered by their duly authorized officers as of the date
hereof. </FONT></P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.II
<SEQUENCE>16
<FILENAME>a2067550zex-10_ii.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10-II
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE> Prepared by MERRILL CORPORATION
</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#02STP1201_15">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10-ii  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>RECEIVABLES SALE AGREEMENT  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>DATED AS OF DECEMBER 12, 2001  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B> AMONG  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B> ADC DSL SYSTEMS,&nbsp;INC.,<BR>
AS ORIGINATOR,  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B> ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC.,<BR>
AS ORIGINATOR AGENT,  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B> AND  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B> ADC RECEIVABLES CORP. I,<BR>
AS BUYER  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ll1201_receivables_sale_agreement"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ll1201_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>RECEIVABLES SALE AGREEMENT    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>THIS RECEIVABLES SALE AGREEMENT,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> dated as of December&nbsp;12, 2001, is by and among ADC DSL Systems,&nbsp;Inc., a Delaware
corporation ( </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Originator"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc., a Minnesota corporation ( </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"ADC Telecom"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), in its capacity as agent for
Originator (in such capacity, the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Originator Agent"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), and ADC Receivables Corp. I, a Minnesota corporation ( </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Buyer"
</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>). </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Unless defined elsewhere herein, capitalized terms used in this Agreement shall have the meanings assigned to such terms in Exhibit&nbsp;I hereto (or, if not defined in
Exhibit&nbsp;I hereto, the meaning assigned to such term in Exhibit&nbsp;I to the Purchase Agreement).  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ll1201_preliminary_statements"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ll1201_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>PRELIMINARY STATEMENTS    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Originator
now owns, and from time to time hereafter will own, Receivables. Originator wishes to sell and assign to Buyer, and Buyer wishes to purchase from Originator, all of
Originator's right, title and interest in and to such Receivables, together with the Related Security and Collections with respect thereto. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Originator
and Buyer intend the transactions contemplated hereby to be true sales of the Receivables from Originator to Buyer, providing Buyer with the full benefits of ownership of the
Receivables, and Originator and Buyer do not intend these transactions to be, or for any purpose to be characterized as, loans from Buyer to Originator. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Following
the purchase of Receivables from Originator, Buyer will sell undivided interests therein and in the associated Related Security and Collections pursuant to that certain
Receivables Purchase
Agreement dated as of December&nbsp;12, 2001 (as the same may from time to time hereafter be amended, supplemented, restated or otherwise modified, the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Purchase Agreement"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) among Buyer,
Originator, as initial Servicer, Blue Ridge Asset Funding Corporation ( </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Blue Ridge"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), the banks and other financial institutions from time to time party thereto as </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"
 </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Liquidity Banks </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> and Wachovia Bank, N.A. or any successor agent appointed pursuant to the terms of the Purchase Agreement, as agent for Blue Ridge and such
Liquidity Banks (in such capacity,
the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Agent"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>). </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>NOW, THEREFORE,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> in consideration of the foregoing premises and the mutual agreements herein contained and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and adequacy of which are hereby
acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ll1201_article_i_amounts_and_terms_of_the_purchase"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ll1201_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>ARTICLE I<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMOUNTS AND TERMS OF THE PURCHASE  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Initial Contribution of Receivables.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On the date of the First Amendment to Receivables Sale
Agreement (the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"First Amendment"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) to be entered into by the parties hereto in form and substance satisfactory to the parties hereto (the "Initial Sale Date"), Originator will contribute, assign,
 transfer,
set-over and otherwise convey to Buyer, and Buyer does hereby accept from Originator, Receivables originated by Originator and existing as of the close of business on the Business Day
immediately prior to the Initial Sale Date (the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Initial Cutoff Date"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) having an aggregate Outstanding Balance in an amount to be specified in the First Amendment (the </FONT> <FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>"Initial Contributed Receivables"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), together with all Related Security relating thereto and all Collections thereof.
 </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Purchase of Receivables.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
on the date of the First Amendment, in consideration for the Purchase Price and upon the terms and subject to the conditions set forth herein, Originator will
sell, assign, transfer, set-over and otherwise convey to Buyer, without recourse (except to the extent expressly provided herein), and
Buyer will purchase from Originator, all of Originator's right, title and interest in and to all Receivables existing as of the close of business on the Initial Cutoff Date </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=4,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="15",CHK=511984,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LL1201A.;10',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_ll1201_1_2"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
(other than the Initial Contributed Receivables) and all Receivables thereafter arising through and including the Termination Date, together, in each case, with all Related Security relating thereto
and all Collections thereof. In accordance with the preceding sentence, on the Initial Sale Date, Buyer shall acquire all of Originator's right, title and interest in and to all Receivables existing
as of the Initial Cut-Off Date and thereafter arising through and including the Termination Date, together with all Related Security relating thereto and all Collections thereof. Buyer
shall be obligated to pay the Purchase Price for the Receivables purchased hereunder in accordance with </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.3  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;On
the 15th day of each month after the Initial Sale Date (or if any such day is not a Business Day, on the next succeeding Business Day thereafter, Originator shall (or
shall require the Servicer to) deliver to Buyer a report in substantially the form of </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;VII  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>hereto (each such report being herein called a </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Purchase Report"
</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) with respect to the Receivables sold by Originator to Buyer during the Settlement Period then most recently ended. In addition to, and not in limitation of, the foregoing, in
connection with the payment of the Purchase Price for any Receivables purchased hereunder, Buyer may request that Originator deliver, and Originator shall deliver, such approvals, opinions,
information or documents as Buyer may reasonably request. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;It
is the intention of the parties hereto that the Purchase of Receivables made hereunder shall constitute a sale, which sale is absolute and irrevocable and provides
Buyer with the full benefits of ownership of the Receivables sufficient to remove the Receivables from Originator's bankruptcy estate. Except for the Purchase Price Credits owed pursuant to </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.4  </I></FONT><FONT
SIZE=2>, the sale of Receivables hereunder is made without recourse to Originator; </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided, however,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>that (i)&nbsp;Originator shall be liable to Buyer for all representations, warranties,
covenants and indemnities made by Originator pursuant to the terms of the Transaction
Documents to which Originator is a party, and (ii)&nbsp;such sale does not constitute and is not intended to result in an assumption by Buyer or any assignee thereof of any obligation of Originator
or any other Person arising in connection with the Receivables, the related Contracts and/or other Related Security or any other obligations of Originator. In view of the intention of the parties
hereto that the Purchase of Receivables made hereunder shall constitute a sale of such Receivables rather than loans secured thereby, Originator agrees that it will, on or prior to the Initial Sale
Date and in accordance with </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;4.1(e)(ii)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, mark its master data processing records relating to the Receivables with a legend acceptable to Buyer and to the Agent (as Buyer's assignee),
evidencing that Buyer has
purchased such Receivables as provided in this Agreement and to note in its financial statements that its Receivables have been sold to Buyer. Upon the request of Buyer or the Agent (as Buyer's
assignee), Originator will execute and file such financing or continuation statements, or amendments thereto or assignments thereof, and such other instruments or notices, as may be necessary or
appropriate to perfect and maintain the perfection
of Buyer's ownership interest in the Receivables and the Related Security and Collections with respect thereto, or as Buyer or the Agent (as Buyer's assignee) may reasonably request. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payment for the Purchase.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Purchase Price for the Purchase of Receivables in existence as of the close of business on the Initial Cutoff Date (other than the Initial Contributed Receivables)
shall be payable in full by Buyer to Originator Agent, for the benefit of Originator, on the Initial Sale Date, and shall be paid to Originator Agent in the following manner: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;by
delivery of immediately available funds, to the extent of funds made available to Buyer in connection with its subsequent sale of an interest in such Receivables to
the Purchasers under the Purchase Agreement; </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided that  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>a portion of such funds shall be offset by amounts owed by Originator to Buyer on account of the issuance of equity having a total
value of not less than the Required Capital
Amount, and </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=5,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="15",CHK=725632,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LL1201A.;10',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_ll1201_1_3"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
balance, by delivery of a Subordinated Note evidencing a subordinated revolving loan from Originator Agent, on behalf of Originator, to Buyer (each, a </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Subordinated Loan"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) in an amount not to
exceed the least of (A)&nbsp;the remaining unpaid portion of such Purchase Price, (B)&nbsp;the maximum Subordinated Loan that could be borrowed
without rendering Buyer's Net Worth less than the Required Capital Amount, and (C)&nbsp;fifteen percent (15%) of such Purchase Price. Originator Agent is hereby authorized by Buyer to endorse on the
schedule attached to the Subordinated Note an appropriate notation evidencing the date and amount of each advance thereunder, as well as the date of each payment with respect thereto, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided that  </I></B></FONT><FONT
SIZE=2>the failure to make such notation shall not affect any obligation of Buyer thereunder. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Purchase Price for each Receivable coming into existence after the Initial Cutoff Date shall be due and owing in full by Buyer to Originator Agent, for the benefit of Originator on the date each
such Receivable came into existence (except that Buyer may, with respect to any such Purchase Price, offset against such Purchase Price any amounts owed by or on behalf of Originator to Buyer
hereunder and which have become due but remain unpaid) and shall be paid to Originator Agent, for the benefit of Originator in the manner provided in the following paragraphs (b), (c)&nbsp;and (d). </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;With
respect to any Receivables coming into existence after the Initial Cutoff Date, on each Settlement Date, Buyer shall pay the Purchase Price therefor to Originator
Agent, for the benefit of
Originator, in accordance with </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.3(d)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>and in the following manner: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>first  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, by delivery of immediately available funds, to the extent of funds available to Buyer from its subsequent sale of an interest in the Receivables to the Agent for the benefit
of the Purchasers under the Purchase Agreement or other cash on hand; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>second,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> by delivery of the proceeds from the repayment of Demand Advances by Originator Agent to Buyer pursuant to the Receivables Purchase Agreement; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>third  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, by delivery of the proceeds of a Subordinated Loan, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided that  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the making of any such Subordinated Loan shall be subject to the
provisions set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.3(a)(ii)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.
 </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Subject
to the limitations set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.3(a)(ii)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, Originator Agent, on behalf of Originator, irrevocably agrees to advance each Subordinated Loan requested by Buyer on or prior to the
Termination Date. The Subordinated Loans
shall be evidenced by, and shall be payable in accordance with the terms and provisions of the Subordinated Note and shall be payable solely from funds which Buyer is not required under the Purchase
Agreement to set aside for the benefit of, or otherwise pay over to, the Purchasers. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;From
and after the Termination Date, Originator shall not be obligated to (but may, at its option) sell Receivables to Buyer. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;Although
the Purchase Price for each Receivable coming into existence after the Initial Cutoff Date shall be due and payable in full by Buyer to Originator Agent, for
the benefit of Originator on the date such Receivable came into existence, settlement of the Purchase Price between Buyer and Originator Agent, for the benefit of Originator shall be effected on a
monthly basis on Settlement Dates with respect to all Receivables coming into existence during the same Calculation Period and based on the information contained in the Purchase Report delivered by
Originator for the Calculation Period then most recently ended. Although settlement shall be effected on Settlement Dates, increases or decreases in the amount owing under the Subordinated Note made
pursuant to </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.3  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>shall be deemed to have occurred and shall be effective as of the last Business Day of the Calculation Period to which such settlement relates. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=6,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="15",CHK=213212,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LL1201A.;10',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_ll1201_1_4"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Purchase Price Credit Adjustments.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>If on any day:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
Outstanding Balance of a Receivable is: </FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;reduced
as a result of any defective or rejected or returned goods or services, any discount or any adjustment or otherwise by Originator (other than as a result of
such Receivable becoming a Charged-Off Receivable or to reflect cash Collections on account of such Receivable), </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;reduced
or canceled as a result of a setoff in respect of any claim by any Person (whether such claim arises out of the same or a related transaction or an unrelated
transaction), or </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;any
of the representations and warranties set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Sections 2.1(h), (i), (j), (l), (r), (s), (t), (u)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the second and third sentences of </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;2.1(q)  </I></FONT><FONT
SIZE=2>hereof and the last clause (relating to bulk sales laws) of </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;2.1(c)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>are not true when made or deemed made with respect to any Receivable, </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>then,
in such event, Buyer shall be entitled to a credit (each, a </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Purchase Price Credit"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) against the Purchase Price otherwise payable hereunder equal to the Outstanding Balance of such Receivable
(calculated before giving effect to the applicable reduction or
cancellation). If such Purchase Price Credit exceeds the Original Balance of the Receivables coming into existence on any day, then Originator Agent, for the benefit of Originator shall pay the
remaining amount of such Purchase Price Credit in cash immediately, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided that  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> if the Termination Date has not occurred, Originator Agent, for the benefit of Originator, shall be allowed to
deduct the remaining amount of such Purchase Price Credit from
any indebtedness owed to Originator Agent under the Subordinated Note. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payments and Computations, Etc.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All amounts to be paid or deposited by Buyer hereunder shall
be paid or deposited in accordance with the terms hereof on the day when due in immediately available funds to the account of Originator Agent, for the benefit of Originator, designated from time
to time by Originator Agent or as otherwise directed by Originator. In the event that any payment owed by any Person hereunder becomes due on a day that is not a Business Day, then such payment shall
be made on the next succeeding Business Day. If any Person fails to pay any amount hereunder when due, such Person agrees to pay, on demand, the Default Fee in respect thereof until paid in full; </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided, however,
</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that such Default Fee shall not at any time exceed the maximum rate permitted by applicable law. All computations of interest payable hereunder shall be made on the basis of a
year of 360&nbsp;days for the actual number of days (including the first but excluding the last day) elapsed. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.6</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Transfer of Records.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;In
connection with the Purchase of Receivables hereunder, Originator hereby sells, transfers, assigns and otherwise conveys to Buyer all of Originator's right and title
to and interest in the Records relating to all Receivables sold or contributed hereunder, without the need for any further documentation in connection with the Purchase. In connection with such
transfer, Originator hereby grants to each of Buyer, the Agent and the Servicer an irrevocable, non-exclusive license to use, without royalty or payment of any kind, all software used by
Originator to account for the Receivables, to the extent necessary to administer the Receivables, whether such software is owned by Originator or is owned by others and used by Originator under
license agreements with respect thereto, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided that  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>should the consent of any licensor of such software be required for the grant of the license described herein to be effective, Originator
hereby agrees that upon the request of
Buyer (or Buyer's assignee), Originator will use its reasonable efforts to obtain the consent of such third-party licensor. The license granted hereby shall be irrevocable until the indefeasible
payment in full of the Aggregate Unpaids, and shall terminate on the date this Agreement terminates in accordance with its terms. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=7,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="15",CHK=269984,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LL1201A.;10',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_ll1201_1_5"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;Originator
(i)&nbsp;shall take such action reasonably requested by Buyer and/or the Agent (as Buyer's assignee), from time to time hereafter, that may be necessary or
appropriate to ensure that Buyer and its assigns under the Purchase Agreement have an enforceable ownership interest in the Records relating to the Receivables purchased from Originator hereunder, and
(ii)&nbsp;shall use its reasonable efforts to ensure that Buyer, the Agent and the Servicer each has an enforceable right (whether by license or sublicense or otherwise) after the occurrence of an
Amortization Event to use all of the computer software used to account for the Receivables and/or to recreate such Records. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.7</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Characterization.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If, notwithstanding the intention of the parties expressed in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.2(c)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, any sale or
contribution by Originator to Buyer of Receivables hereunder shall be characterized as a secured loan and not a sale or such sale shall for any reason be
ineffective or unenforceable, then this Agreement shall be deemed to constitute a security agreement under the UCC and other applicable law. For this purpose and without being in derogation of the
parties' intention that the sale of Receivables hereunder shall constitute a true sale thereof, Originator hereby grants to Buyer a duly
perfected security interest in all of Originator's right, title and interest in, to and under all Receivables now existing and hereafter arising, all Collections and Related Security with respect
thereto, each Lock-Box and Collection Account, all other rights and payments relating to the Receivables and all proceeds of the foregoing to secure the prompt and complete payment of a
loan deemed to have been made in an amount equal to the Purchase Price of the Receivables together with all other obligations of Originator hereunder, which security interest shall be prior to all
other Adverse Claims thereto. Buyer and its assigns shall have, in addition to the rights and remedies which they may have under this Agreement, all other rights and remedies provided to a secured
creditor under the UCC and other applicable law, which rights and remedies shall be cumulative. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.8</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Allocation of Purchase Price and Indemnification.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;Originator
hereby designates and appoints ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc. to act as its agent hereunder, and authorizes ADC Telecom to take such actions as agent on
its behalf and to exercise such powers as are delegated to the Originator Agent by the terms of this Agreement, together with such powers as are reasonably incidental thereto. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;As
described in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Sections 1.3  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>and </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>1.4  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, Buyer shall pay the Purchase Price for Receivables generated by Originator and the Receivables generated by ADC
Telecommunications Sales,&nbsp;Inc. (the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"ADC Sales"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) to the Originator Agent in full performance and satisfaction of Buyer's Purchase Price payment obligations hereunder and under a
receivables sale agreement between ADC Sales
and Buyer. The Originator Agent shall be solely responsible to properly allocate and remit such payment, and all other Buyer Payments, to the Originator and the ADC Sales pursuant to this subsection
(b)&nbsp;in respect of the Receivables sold by Originator and ADC Sales. Notwithstanding the provisions described in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Sections 1.3 and 1.4  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>concerning the Buyer's payment of the Purchase Price of
Receivables generated by the Originator, to the extent Receivables generated by the Originator are sold to the Buyer
during the same Calculation Period as Receivables generated by the ADC Sales are sold to the Buyer, the Originator Agent shall upon receipt of the Buyer Payment of the Receivables make an allocation
and remittance of such Buyer Payment to the Originator and the ADC Sales as follows: </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>first  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, any cash received from Buyer on a Settlement Date shall be distributed to the Originator in proportion to the unpaid
amount of its Purchase Price of all Receivables sold by
the Originator during such Calculation Period: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>second  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, to the extent cash received by the Originator Agent on the Settlement Date from Buyer is insufficient to pay the Purchase Price to the Originator in full, the Originator
Agent, on behalf of Originator, shall
make a Subordinated Loan to Buyer subject to the limitations of </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.3(a)(ii)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>; and </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=8,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="15",CHK=1024929,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LL1201B.;9',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_ll1201_1_6"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>third  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, once the Purchase Price for the Receivables transferred by the Originator has been paid in full, the Purchase Price paid to the ADC Sales shall occur in the manner outlined
in Section&nbsp;1.3(b) of the receivables sale agreement between ADC Sales and the Buyer. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Originator
agrees that: </FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;Buyer's
payment to the Originator Agent, as Originator's and ADC Sales' agent, of the Purchase Price for any Receivable originated by Originator or ADC Sales shall
constitute full payment to such party for such Receivable; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon
such payment to the Originator Agent by Buyer, Originator and ADC Sales shall look only to the Originator Agent for the proper allocation and remittance of Buyer
Payments for such Receivables and shall indemnify and hold Buyer harmless for any act, omission, failure or error by the Originator Agent in connection with the proper allocation or remittance of any
amounts due to Originator or ADC Sales from the Originator Agent. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ll1201_article_ii_representations_and_warranties"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ll1201_4"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>ARTICLE II<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Representations and Warranties of Originator.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Originator hereby represents and warrants to
Buyer on the date hereof, on the date of the Purchase and on each date that any Receivable comes into existence that: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Existence and Power.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Originator is a corporation duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of
Delaware. Originator is validly existing and in good standing under the laws of Delaware and is duly qualified to do business and is in good standing as a foreign entity, and has and holds all
corporate power and all governmental licenses, authorizations, consents and approvals required to carry on its business in each jurisdiction in which its business is conducted except where the failure
to so qualify or so hold could not reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Power and Authority; Due Authorization, Execution and Delivery.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The execution and delivery by Originator of this Agreement and each other Transaction Document to which it is a party, and the performance of its
obligations hereunder and
thereunder and, Originator's use of the proceeds of the Purchase made hereunder, are within its organizational powers and authority and have been duly authorized by all necessary organizational action
on its part. This Agreement and each other Transaction Document to which Originator is a party has been duly executed and delivered by Originator. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>No Conflict.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The execution and delivery by Originator of this Agreement and each other Transaction Document to which it is a party, and the performance of its obligations hereunder and
thereunder do not contravene or violate (i)&nbsp;its Organizational Documents, (ii)&nbsp;any law, rule or regulation applicable to it, (iii)&nbsp;any restrictions under any agreement, contract
or instrument to which it is a party or by which it or any of its property is bound, or (iv)&nbsp;any order, writ, judgment, award, injunction or decree binding on or affecting it or its property,
and do not result in the creation or imposition of any Adverse Claim on assets of Originator or its Subsidiaries (except as created hereunder) except, in any case, where such contravention or
violation could not reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect; and no transaction contemplated hereby requires compliance with any bulk sales act or similar law. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Governmental Authorization.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Other than the filing of the financing statements required hereunder, no authorization or approval or other action by, and no notice to or filing with, any governmental
authority or regulatory body is required for the due execution and delivery by </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=9,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="15",CHK=466830,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LL1201B.;9',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_ll1201_1_7"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
Originator of this Agreement and each other Transaction Document to which it is a party and the performance of its obligations hereunder and thereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Actions, Suits.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>There are no actions, suits or proceedings pending, or to the best of Originator's knowledge, threatened, against or affecting Originator, or any of its properties, in or
before any court, arbitrator or other body, that could reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect. Originator is not in default with respect to any order of any court, arbitrator or
governmental body that could reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Binding Effect.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>This Agreement and each other Transaction Document to which Originator is a party constitute the legal, valid and binding obligations of Originator enforceable against
Originator in accordance with their respective terms, except as such enforcement may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization or other similar laws relating to or limiting
creditors' rights generally and by general principles of equity (regardless of whether enforcement is sought in a proceeding in equity or at law). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Accuracy of Information.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>All information heretofore furnished by Originator or any of its Affiliates to Buyer (or its
assigns) for purposes of or in connection with this Agreement, any of the other
Transaction Documents or any transaction contemplated hereby or thereby is, and all such information hereafter furnished by Originator or any of its Affiliates to Buyer (or its assigns) will be, true
and accurate in every material respect on the date such information is stated or certified and does not and will not contain any material misstatement of fact or omit to state a material fact or any
fact necessary to make the statements contained therein, taken as a whole, not misleading. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Use of Proceeds.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>No portion of any Purchase Price payment hereunder will be used to acquire any security in any
transaction which is subject to Section&nbsp;12, 13 or 14 of the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Good Title.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Immediately prior to the Purchase hereunder and upon the creation of each Receivable coming into existence after the Initial Cut-Off Date, Originator (i)&nbsp;is
the legal and beneficial owner of the Receivables and (ii)&nbsp;is the legal and beneficial owner of the Related Security with respect thereto or possesses a valid and perfected security interest
therein, in each case, free and clear of any Adverse Claim, except as created by the Transaction Documents. There have been duly filed all financing statements or other similar instruments or
documents necessary under the UCC (or any comparable law) of all appropriate jurisdictions to perfect Originator's ownership interest in each Receivable, its Collections and the Related Security. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(j)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Perfection.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>This Agreement, together with the filing of the financing statements contemplated hereby, is effective to transfer to Buyer (and Buyer shall acquire from Originator)
(i)&nbsp;legal and equitable title to, with the right to sell and encumber each Receivable existing and hereafter arising, together with the Collections with respect thereto, and (ii)&nbsp;all of
Originator's right, title and interest in the Related Security associated with each Receivable, in each case, free and clear of any Adverse Claim, except as created by the Transactions Documents.
There have been duly filed all financing statements or other similar instruments or documents necessary under the UCC (or any comparable law) of all appropriate jurisdictions to perfect Buyer's
ownership interest in the Receivables, the Related Security and the
Collections. Originator's jurisdiction of organization is a jurisdiction whose law generally requires information concerning the existence of a nonpossessory security interest to be made generally
available in a filing, record or registration system as a condition or result of such a security interest's obtaining priority over the rights of a lien creditor which respect to collateral. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(k)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Places of Business and Locations of Records.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The principal places of business and chief executive office of Originator and
the offices where it keeps all of its Records are located at the address(es) listed on </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;II  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>or such other locations of which Buyer has been notified in </FONT></P>

</UL>

accordance with </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;4.2(a)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>in jurisdictions where all action required by </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;4.2(a)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>has been taken and completed. Originator's Federal
Employer Identification Number or organizational number is correctly set forth on
</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;II  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(l)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Collections.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The conditions and requirements set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;4.1(j)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>have at all times been satisfied and duly performed. The names and addresses of
all Collection Banks, together with the account numbers of the Collection Accounts of Originator
at each Collection Bank and the post office box number of each Lock-Box, are listed on </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;III  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Originator has not granted any Person, other than Buyer (and its assigns) dominion and control
of any Lock-Box or Collection Account, or the right to take
dominion and control of any such Lock-Box or Collection Account at a future time or upon the occurrence of a future event. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(m)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Material Adverse Effect.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Since December&nbsp;31, 2000, no event has occurred that would have a Material Adverse Effect.
</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(n)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Names.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The name in which Originator has executed this Agreement is identical to the name of Originator as indicated on the public record of its state of organization which shows
Originator to have been organized. In the past five (5)&nbsp;years, Originator has not used any corporate names, trade names or assumed names other than the name in which it has executed this
Agreement and as listed on </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;II  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(o)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Ownership of Buyer.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>ADC Telecom owns, directly or indirectly, 100% of the issued and outstanding equity interests of Buyer, free and clear of any Adverse Claim. Such equity interests are validly
issued, fully paid and nonassessable, and there are no options, warrants or other rights to acquire securities of Buyer. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(p)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Not a Holding Company or an Investment Company.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Originator is not a </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>"holding company"
</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> or a </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>"subsidiary holding company"  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> of a </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>"holding company"  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> within the meaning of the Public Utility Holding Company Act of 1935,
 as amended, or any successor statute. Originator is not an </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>"investment company"  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> within the meaning of the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended, or any successor statute. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(q)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Compliance with Law.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Originator has complied in all respects with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, orders, writs,
judgments, injunctions, decrees or awards to which it may be subject,
except where the failure to so comply could not reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect. Each Receivable, together with the Contract related thereto, does not contravene any laws,
rules or regulations applicable thereto ( </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>including  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>without limitation  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, laws, rules and regulations relating to truth in lending, fair
credit billing, fair credit reporting, equal credit opportunity, fair debt collection practices and privacy),
and no part of such Contract is in violation of any such law, rule or regulation, except where such contravention or violation could not reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(r)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Compliance with Credit and Collection Policy.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Originator has complied in all material respects with the Credit and Collection Policy with regard to each Receivable and the related Contract, and has not made
any material
adverse change to such Credit and Collection Policy except such material adverse changes as to which Buyer and its assigns have been notified in accordance with </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;4.1(a)(vii)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;and have
given their prior written consent. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(s)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Payments to Originator.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>With respect to each Receivable transferred to Buyer hereunder, the Purchase Price received by
Originator constitutes reasonably equivalent value in consideration therefor. No
transfer by Originator of any Receivable hereunder is or may be voidable under any section of the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1978 (11 U.S.C. &sect;&sect; 101 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>et seq  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>.  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>),
 as amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(t)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Enforceability of Contracts.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Each Contract with respect to each Receivable is effective to create, and has created, a legal, valid and binding obligation of the related Obligor to pay the </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>8</FONT></P>

<A NAME="page_ll1201_1_9"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
Outstanding Balance of the Receivable created thereunder and any accrued interest thereon, enforceable against the Obligor in accordance with its terms, except as such enforcement may be limited by
applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization or other similar laws relating to or limiting creditors' rights generally and by general principles of equity (regardless of whether enforcement is
sought in a proceeding in equity or at law). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(u)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Eligible Receivables.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Each Receivable reflected in any Purchase Report as an Eligible Receivable was an Eligible
Receivable on the date of its acquisition by Buyer hereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Accounting.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The manner in which Originator accounts for the transactions contemplated by this Agreement does not jeopardize the characterization of the transactions contemplated herein as
being true sales as contemplated in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.2(c)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ll1201_article_iii_conditions_of_purchase"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ll1201_5"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>ARTICLE III<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CONDITIONS OF PURCHASE  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;3.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conditions Precedent to Purchase.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Purchase under this Agreement is subject to the
conditions precedent that (a)&nbsp;Buyer shall have been capitalized with the Initial Contributed Receivables, (b)&nbsp;Buyer shall have received on or before the date of such purchase those
documents listed on </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;A  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>and (c)&nbsp;all of the conditions to the initial purchase under the Purchase Agreement shall have been satisfied or waived in accordance with the terms thereof;
provided
that the execution of this Agreement by the parties hereto shall not be deemed a waiver of any condition precedent to the Purchase under this Agreement in any way. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;3.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conditions Precedent to Subsequent Payments.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Buyer's obligation to pay for Receivables coming
into existence after the Initial Cutoff Date shall be subject to the further conditions precedent that: (a)&nbsp;the Facility Termination Date shall not have occurred under the Purchase Agreement;
(b)&nbsp;Buyer (or its assigns) shall have received such other approvals, opinions or documents as it may reasonably request and (c)&nbsp;on the date such Receivable came into existence, the
following statements shall be true (and acceptance of the proceeds of any payment for such Receivable shall be deemed a representation and warranty by Originator that such statements are then true): </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
representations and warranties set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Article&nbsp;II  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>are true and correct on and as of the date such Receivable came into existence as though made on and as of such date; and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;no
event has occurred and is continuing that will constitute a Termination Event or an Unmatured Termination Event. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Notwithstanding
the foregoing conditions precedent, upon payment of the Purchase Price for any Receivable (whether by payment of cash, through an increase in the amounts outstanding under the
Subordinated Note, by offset of amounts owed to Buyer and/or by offset of capital contributions), title to such Receivable and the Related Security and Collections with respect thereto shall vest in
Buyer, whether or not the conditions precedent to Buyer's obligation to pay for such Receivable were in fact satisfied. The failure of Originator to satisfy any of the foregoing conditions precedent,
however, shall give rise to a right of Buyer to rescind the related purchase and direct Originator to pay to Buyer an amount equal to the Purchase Price payment that shall have been made with respect
to any Receivables related thereto. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
