<A NAME="page_lo1201_1_4"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Originator"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in the preamble to the Agreement. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Originator Agent"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in the preamble to the Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"PBGC"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation, or any successor thereto. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Pension Plan"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means a pension plan (as defined in Section&nbsp;3(2) of ERISA) subject to Title IV of ERISA which Originator sponsors or maintains, or to which it makes, is making, or is
obligated to make contributions, or in the case of a multiple employer plan (as described in Section&nbsp;4064(a) of ERISA) has made contributions at any time during the immediately preceding five
plan years. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Plan"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an employee benefit plan (as defined in Section&nbsp;3(3) of ERISA) which Originator Agent sponsors or maintains or
to which Originator Agent makes, is making, or is
obligated to make contributions and includes any Pension Plan, other than a Plan maintained outside the United States primarily for the benefit of Persons who are not U.S. residents. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Purchase"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the purchase pursuant to </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.2(a)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Agreement by Buyer from Originator of the Receivables and the Related Security and
Collections related thereto, together with all related rights in connection therewith.
 </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Purchase Agreement"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in the Preliminary Statements to the Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Purchase Price"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, with respect to the Purchase, the aggregate price to be paid by Buyer to Originator Agent, for the benefit of Originator, in accordance with </FONT> <FONT
SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.3  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Agreement for the Receivables, Collections and Related Security being sold to Buyer, which price shall equal on any date (i)&nbsp;the product of (x)&nbsp;the
Outstanding Balance of such Receivables on such date, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>multiplied by  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (y)&nbsp;one minus the Discount Factor in effect on such date, minus (ii)&nbsp;any Purchase Price Credits to be credited
against the Purchase Price otherwise payable in
accordance with </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.4  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Purchase Price Credit"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.4  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Agreement. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Purchase Report"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.2(b)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the
Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Receivable"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means all indebtedness and other obligations owed by any Domestic Person to Originator (at the times it arises, and
before giving effect to any transfer or conveyance under
the Agreement) or to Buyer (after giving effect to the transfers under the Agreement) or in which Originator or Buyer has a security interest or other interest, including, without limitation, any
indebtedness, obligation or interest constituting an account, chattel paper, instrument or general intangible, arising in connection with the sale of goods or the rendering of services by Originator,
and further includes, without limitation, the obligation to pay any Finance Charges with respect thereto. Indebtedness and other rights and obligations arising from any one transaction, including,
without limitation, indebtedness and other rights and obligations represented by an individual invoice, shall constitute a Receivable separate from a Receivable consisting of the indebtedness and
other rights and obligations arising from any other transaction; </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>further  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that any indebtedness, rights or obligations
referred to in the immediately preceding sentence shall be a Receivable regardless or whether the account debtor or Originator
treats such indebtedness, rights or obligations as a separate payment obligation. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Related Security"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, with respect to any Receivable: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
of Originator's remaining interest (if any) in the inventory and goods (including returned or repossessed inventory or goods), the sale of which by Originator gave
rise to such Receivable, and all insurance contracts with respect thereto, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
other security interests or liens and property subject thereto from time to time, if any, purporting to secure payment of such Receivable, whether pursuant to the
Contract related to such Receivable or otherwise, together with all financing statements and security agreements describing any collateral securing such Receivable, </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=28,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="15",CHK=292969,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LO1201A.;11',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_lo1201_1_5"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
guaranties, letters of credit, insurance and other agreements or arrangements of whatever character from time to time supporting or securing payment of such
Receivable whether pursuant to the Contract related to such Receivable or otherwise, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
service contracts and other contracts and agreements associated with such Receivable, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
Records related to such Receivable, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
of Originator's right, title and interest in each Lock-Box and each Collection Account, and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vii)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
proceeds of any of the foregoing. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Reportable Event"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means any of the events set forth in Section&nbsp;4043(c) of ERISA or the regulations thereunder, other than any such event for which the 30-day notice
requirement under ERISA has been waived in regulations issued by the PBGC. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Required Capital Amount"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, as of any date of determination, an amount in cash, assets or a mixture of both (including Initial Contributed Receivables) equal to the greater of (a)&nbsp;3% of the
Purchase Limit under the Purchase Agreement, and (b)&nbsp;the product of (i)&nbsp;1.5 times the product of the Default Ratio times the Default Horizon Ratio </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>,  </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> each as determined from the most recent
Monthly Report received from the Servicer under the Purchase Agreement, and (ii)&nbsp;the Outstanding Balance of all Receivables as
of such date, as determined from the most recent Monthly Report received from the Servicer under the Purchase Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"S&amp;P"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means Standard and Poor's Ratings Services, a division of The McGraw Hill Companies,&nbsp;Inc. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Settlement Date"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, with respect to each Calculation Period, the date that is the calendar day of the month following such Calculation Period as specified in the First Amendment. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Subordinated Loan"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.3(a)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Subordinated Note"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means a promissory note in substantially the form of </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;VI
</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>hereto as more fully described in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;1.3  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Agreement, as the same may be amended, restated, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Tax Code"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as the same may be amended from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Termination Date"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the earliest to occur of (i)&nbsp;the Facility Termination Date (as defined in the Purchase Agreement),
(ii)&nbsp;the Business Day immediately prior to the
occurrence of a Termination Event set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;5.1(d)  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, (iii)&nbsp;the Business Day specified in a written notice from Buyer to Originator following the occurrence of any other Termination
Event, and (iv)&nbsp;the date which
is 5 Business Days after Buyer's receipt of written notice from Originator that it wishes to terminate the facility evidenced by this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Termination Event"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;5.1  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the
Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Transaction Documents"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, collectively, this Agreement, each Collection Account Agreement, the Subordinated Note, and all other instruments, documents and agreements executed and delivered in
connection herewith. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Unmatured Termination Event"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an event which, with the passage of time or the giving of notice, or both, would constitute a
Termination Event. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>All accounting terms not specifically defined herein shall be construed in accordance with GAAP. All terms used in Article&nbsp;9 of the UCC in the State of New York, and not
specifically defined herein, are used herein as defined in such Article&nbsp;9.  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10-jj  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lr1201_first_amendment_to_receivables_sale_agreement"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lr1201_1"> </A></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>FIRST AMENDMENT TO RECEIVABLES SALE AGREEMENT    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>THIS FIRST AMENDMENT TO RECEIVABLES SALE AGREEMENT,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> dated as of December&nbsp;21, 2001 (this " </FONT> <FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Amendment  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), is by and among ADC DSL Systems,&nbsp;Inc. (the " </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Originator  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc. (the " </FONT> <FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Originator Agent  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") and ADC Receivables Corp. I (" </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Buyer  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), and pertains to the Receivables Sale Agreement dated as of December&nbsp;12, 2001 amongst
the parties hereto (the " </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Agreement  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>").
</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Unless otherwise defined in this Amendment shall have the meanings assigned to such terms in the Agreement or in the Purchase Agreement described therein.  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>PRELIMINARY STATEMENTS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>WHEREAS,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the Buyer, Originator Agent and the Originator wish to amend the Agreement as set forth herein; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>WHEREAS,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the Agent, on behalf of Blue Ridge under the Purchase Agreement, is willing to consent to such amendment. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>NOW, THEREFORE,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> in consideration of the foregoing premises and the mutual agreements herein contained and other
good and valuable consideration, the receipt and adequacy of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amendments.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.1
of the Agreement is amended and restated in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>[Intentionally Deleted]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;Sections
1.2(a) and 1.3(a) are hereby amended by deleting the parenthetical "(other than the Initial Contributed Receivables)" contained therein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.6(a)
of the Agreement is hereby amended by deleting the phrase "or contributed" contained therein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.7
of the Agreement is hereby amended by deleting the phrase "or contribution" contained therein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;3.1(b)
of the Agreement is hereby amended by adding the parenthetical "(as defined in that certain Receivables Sale Agreement, dated as of
December&nbsp;12, 2001 by and among ADC Telecommunications Sale,&nbsp;Inc., Originator Agent and Buyer as the same has been and may be amended from time to time)" immediately at the end thereof. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
parenthetical contained in the second to last sentence of Section&nbsp;3.2 of the Agreement is hereby amended and restated to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"(whether
by payment of cash, through an increase in the amounts outstanding under the Subordinated Note and/or by offset of amounts owed to Buyer)" </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;4.2(e)
of the Agreement is hereby amended by deleting the phrase "or a capital contribution" wherever it appears herein. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;&nbsp;Exhibit&nbsp;I
to the Agreement is hereby amended by amending in their entirety the following definitions appearing therein: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Discount Factor"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means a percentage calculated to provide Buyer with a reasonable return on its investment in the Receivables after taking account of (i)&nbsp;the time value of money based
upon the anticipated dates of collection of the Receivables and the cost to Buyer of financing its investment in the Receivables during such period and (ii)&nbsp;the risk of nonpayment by the
Obligors. Originator and Buyer may agree from time to time to change the Discount Factor based on changes in one or more of the items affecting the calculation thereof, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided that  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> any change
to the Discount Factor shall take effect as of the commencement of a </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="16",CHK=707491,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LR1201A.;14',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_lr1201_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Calculation
Period, shall apply only prospectively and shall not affect the Purchase Price payment made prior to the Calculation Period during which Originator and Buyer agree to make such change. As
of the date of the First Amendment, the Discount Factor in respect of Eligible Receivables and all other Receivables is equal to a percentage specified in the Second Amendment. </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Initial Cutoff Date"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the close of business on the Business Day immediately prior to the Initial Sale Date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Required Capital Amount"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, as of any date of determination, an amount in cash, assets or a mixture of both equal to the greater of (a)&nbsp;3% of the Purchase Limit under the Purchase
Agreement, and (b)&nbsp;the product of (i)&nbsp;1.5 times the product of the Default Ratio times the Default Horizon Ratio </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>,  </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> each as determined from the most recent Monthly Report received from the
Servicer under the Purchase Agreement, and (ii)&nbsp;the Outstanding Balance of all Receivables as
of such date, as determined from the most recent Monthly Report received from the Servicer under the Purchase Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Settlement Date"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, with respect to each Calculation Period, the date that is the 17<SUP>th</SUP> day of the month following such Calculation Period. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exhibit&nbsp;I
to the Agreement is hereby amended by adding the following definitions: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Initial Sale Date"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the date on which the Originator assigns, transfers, sets-over or otherwise conveys to Buyer the Receivables. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Second Amendment"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an amendment to this Agreement mutually agreed upon by the parties hereto. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(j)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exhibit&nbsp;I
to the Agreement is hereby amended by deleting in their entirety the following definition: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Initial Contributed Receivables"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;1.1. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Representations and Warranties.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to induce the other parties hereto to enter into this Amendment,
each of the Buyer and the Originators hereby represents and warrants to each of the other parties hereto as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;The
execution and delivery by such party of this Amendment, and the performance of its obligations under the Agreement as amended hereby, are within such party's
organizational powers and authority and have been duly authorized by all necessary organizational action on its part; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;This
Amendment has been duly executed and delivered by such party, and the Agreement, as amended hereby, constitutes such party's legal, valid and binding obligation,
enforceable against such party in accordance with its terms, except as such enforcement may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization or other similar laws relating to or
limiting creditors' rights generally and by general principles of equity (regardless of whether enforcement is sought in a proceeding in equity or at law), and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;As
of the date hereof, no event has occurred and is continuing that will constitute a Termination Event or an Unmatured Termination Event. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conditions Precedent.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Amendment shall become effective as of the date first above written upon execution
and delivery of a counterpart hereof by each of the Originator, the Originator Agent, the Buyer and the Agent. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="16",CHK=387219,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LR1201A.;14',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_lr1201_1_3"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Miscellaneous.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>CHOICE OF LAW  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. THIS AMENDMENT SHALL BE GOVERNED AND CONSTRUED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE INTERNAL LAWS (AND NOT THE LAW OF CONFLICTS) OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Counterparts  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. This Amendment may be executed in any number of counterparts and by different parties hereto in separate counterparts, each of which when so executed shall be deemed to be an
original and all of which when taken together shall constitute one and the same agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Ratification of Agreement  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Except as expressly amended hereby, the Agreement remains unaltered and in full force and effect and is hereby ratified and confirmed. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><I>&lt;signature pages follow&gt;  </I></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="16",CHK=957208,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LR1201A.;14',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>IN WITNESS WHEREOF,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the parties hereto have caused this Amendment to be executed and delivered by their duly authorized officers as of the date
hereof. </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=4,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="17",CHK=7027,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LT1201A.;10',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lu1201_receivables_purchase_agreement"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lu1201_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>RECEIVABLES PURCHASE AGREEMENT    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>This Receivables Purchase Agreement,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> dated as of December&nbsp;12, 2001 is entered into by and among: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;ADC
Receivables Corp. I, a Minnesota corporation ( </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Seller"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;ADC
Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc., a Minnesota corporation ( </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"ADC Telecom"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), as initial Servicer, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;Blue
Ridge Asset Funding Corporation, a Delaware corporation ( </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Blue Ridge"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;Wachovia
Bank, N.A., as agent for Blue Ridge and its assigns under the Transaction Documents and under the Liquidity Agreement (together with its successors and assigns
in such capacity, the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Agent"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>). </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Unless defined elsewhere herein, capitalized terms used in this Agreement shall have the meanings assigned to such terms in Exhibit&nbsp;I.  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lu1201_preliminary_statements"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lu1201_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>PRELIMINARY STATEMENTS  </I></B></FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Seller
desires to transfer and assign Receivable Interests from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Blue
Ridge shall purchase Receivable Interests from Seller from time to time either by issuing its Commercial Paper or by availing itself of a Liquidity Funding to the extent available. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Wachovia
Bank, N.A. has been requested and is willing to act as Agent on behalf of Blue Ridge and its assigns in accordance with the terms hereof. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lu1201_article_i._purchase_arrangements"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lu1201_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE I.    <BR>    <BR>    PURCHASE ARRANGEMENTS    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
1.1</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Purchase Facility.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon
the terms and subject to the conditions of this Agreement (including, without limitation, Article&nbsp;VI), from time to time after the execution of the First
Amendment but prior to the Facility Termination Date, Seller may request that Blue Ridge purchase from Seller undivided ownership interests in the Receivables and the associated Related Security and
Collections, and Blue Ridge shall make such Purchase; </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided that  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>no Purchase shall be made by Blue Ridge if, after giving effect thereto, either (i)the Aggregate Invested Amount would exceed
the Purchase Limit, or (ii)&nbsp;the aggregate
of the Receivable Interests would exceed 100%. It is the intent of Blue Ridge to fund the Purchases by the issuance of Commercial Paper. If for any reason Blue Ridge is unable, or determines that it
is undesirable, to issue Commercial Paper to fund or maintain its investment in the Receivable Interests, or is unable for any reason to repay such Commercial Paper upon the maturity thereof, Blue
Ridge will avail itself of a Liquidity Funding to the extent available. If Blue Ridge funds or refinances its investment in a Receivable Interest through a Liquidity Fundings, in lieu of paying CP
Costs on the Invested Amount pursuant to Article&nbsp;III hereof, Seller will pay Yield thereon at the Alternate Base Rate or the LIBO Rate, selected in accordance with Article&nbsp;IV hereof.
Nothing herein shall be deemed to constitute a commitment of Blue Ridge to issue Commercial Paper. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;Seller
may, upon at least 5 Business Days' notice to the Agent, terminate in whole or reduce in part, the unused portion of the Purchase Limit; </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided that  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> each partial reduction of the Purchase
Limit shall be in an amount equal to $10,000,000 (or a larger integral multiple of $1,000,000 if in excess thereof). </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
1.2</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Incremental Purchases.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Seller shall provide the Agent with at least two (2)&nbsp;Business Days'
prior written notice in a form set forth as Exhibit&nbsp;II hereto of each Incremental Purchase (each, a </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Purchase Notice"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>). Each Purchase Notice shall be subject to Section&nbsp;6.2 hereof and,
 except as set forth below, shall be irrevocable and shall specify the requested Purchase Price (which
shall not be less </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=5,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="17",CHK=814015,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LU1201A.;4',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_lu1201_1_2"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
than $1,000,000 or a larger integral multiple of $100,000) and the Purchase Date (which, in the case of any Incremental Purchase after the initial Purchase hereunder, shall only be on a Settlement
Date). Following receipt of a Purchase Notice, the Agent will determine whether Blue Ridge will fund the requested Incremental Purchase through the issuance of Commercial Paper or through a Liquidity
Funding. If Blue Ridge determines to fund an Incremental Purchase through a Liquidity Funding, Seller may cancel the Purchase Notice or, in the absence of such a cancellation, the Incremental Purchase
will be funded through a Liquidity Funding. The Agent shall notify the Seller as soon as possible of any determination by Blue Ridge to fund any Incremental Purchase through a Liquidity Funding. On
each Purchase Date, upon satisfaction of the applicable conditions precedent set forth in Article&nbsp;VI, Blue Ridge shall deposit to the Facility Account, in immediately available funds, no later
than 2:00&nbsp;p.m. (New York time), an amount equal to the requested Purchase Price. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
1.3</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Decreases.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Seller shall provide the Agent with prior written notice in conformity with the Required
Notice Period (a </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Reduction Notice"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) of any proposed reduction of Aggregate Invested Amount. Such Reduction Notice shall designate (i)&nbsp;the date (the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Proposed
Reduction Date"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) upon which any such reduction of Aggregate Invested Amount shall occur (which date shall give effect to the applicable Required Notice Period), and (ii)&nbsp;the amount of
Aggregate Invested Amount to be reduced which shall be applied ratably to all Receivable Interests in accordance with the respective Invested Amounts thereof (the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Aggregate Reduction"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>). Only
one (1)&nbsp;Reduction Notice shall be outstanding at any time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
1.4</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deemed Collections; Purchase Limit.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;If
on any day: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Outstanding Balance of any Receivable is reduced or cancelled as a result of any defective or rejected goods or services, any cash discount or any other adjustment
by any Originator or any Affiliate thereof, or as a result of any governmental or regulatory action, or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Outstanding Balance of any Receivable is reduced or canceled as a result of a setoff in respect of any claim by the Obligor thereof (whether such claim arises out
of the same or a related or an unrelated transaction), or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Outstanding Balance of any Receivable is reduced on account of the obligation of any Originator or any Affiliate thereof to pay to the related Obligor any rebate
or refund, or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Outstanding Balance of any Receivable is less than the amount included in calculating the Net Pool Balance for purposes of any Monthly Report (for any reason other
than receipt of Collections or such Receivable becoming a Defaulted Receivable), or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)&nbsp;&nbsp;any
of the representations or warranties of Seller set forth in Section&nbsp;5.1(g), (i), (j), (r), (s), (t)&nbsp;or (u)&nbsp;were not true when made with respect
to any Receivable, </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>then,
on such day, Seller shall be deemed to have received a Collection of such Receivable (A)&nbsp;in the case of clauses (i)-(iv)&nbsp;above, in the amount of such reduction or cancellation or
the difference between the actual Outstanding Balance and the amount included in calculating such Net Pool Balance, as applicable; and (B)&nbsp;in the case of clause&nbsp;(v) above, in the amount
of the Outstanding Balance of such Receivable and, effective as of the next succeeding Settlement Date shall pay to the Agent's Account the amount of any such Collection deemed to have been received
in the same manner as actual cash Collections are distributed under the terms of this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;Seller
shall ensure that the Aggregate Invested Amount at no time exceeds the Purchase Limit. If at any time the Aggregate Invested Amount exceeds the Purchase Limit,
Seller shall pay to the Agent immediately an amount to be applied to reduce the Aggregate Invested Amount (as </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=6,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="17",CHK=118112,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LU1201A.;4',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_lu1201_1_3"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
allocated by the Agent), such that after giving effect to such payment the Aggregate Invested Amount is less than or equal to the Purchase Limit. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;Seller
shall also ensure that the Receivable Interests shall at no time exceed in the aggregate 100%. If the aggregate of the Receivable Interests exceeds 100%, Seller
shall pay to the Agent on or before the next succeeding Settlement Date (or, if such excess is discovered on a Settlement Date, on such Settlement Date) an amount to be applied to reduce the Aggregate
Invested Amount (as allocated by the Agent), such that after giving effect to such payment the aggregate of the Receivable Interests equals or is less than 100%. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
1.5</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payment Requirements and Computations.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All amounts to be paid or deposited by any Seller Party
pursuant to any provision of this Agreement shall be paid or deposited in accordance with the terms hereof no later than 12:00 noon (New York time) on the day when due in immediately available funds,
and if not received before 12:00 noon (New York time) shall be deemed to be received on the next succeeding Business Day. If such amounts are payable to the Agent for the account of Blue Ridge, they
shall be paid to the Agent's Account, for the account of Blue Ridge until otherwise notified by the Agent. Upon notice to Seller, the Agent may debit the Facility Account for all amounts due and
payable hereunder. All computations of CP Costs, Yield, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>per annum  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> fees calculated as part of any CP Costs, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>per annum  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> fees hereunder and </FONT> <FONT
SIZE=2><I>per annum  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> fees under the Fee Letter shall be made on the basis of a year of 360&nbsp;days for the actual number of days elapsed. If any amount hereunder shall be payable on a day
which is not a Business Day, such amount shall be payable on the next succeeding Business Day. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lu1201_article_ii._payments_and_collections"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lu1201_4"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE II.    <BR>    <BR>    PAYMENTS AND COLLECTIONS    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
2.1</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payments of Recourse Obligations.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Seller hereby promises to pay the following (collectively, the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Recourse Obligations"
</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>): </FONT></P>

<UL>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
amounts due and owing under Section&nbsp;1.3 or 1.4 on the dates specified therein; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
fees set forth in the Fee Letter on the dates specified therein; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
accrued and unpaid Yield on the Receivable Interests accruing Yield at the Alternate Base Rate or the Default Rate on each Settlement Date applicable thereto; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
accrued and unpaid Yield on the Receivable Interests accruing Yield at the LIBO Rate on the last day of each Interest Period applicable thereto; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;all
accrued and unpaid CP Costs on the Receivable Interests funded with Commercial Paper on each Settlement Date; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all
Broken Funding Costs and Indemnified Amounts upon demand. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
2.2</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Collections Prior to the Facility Termination Date; Repayment of Certain Demand Advances.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior
to the Facility Termination Date, any Deemed Collections received by the Servicer and Blue Ridge's Portion of any Collections received by the Servicer shall be set
aside and held in trust by the Servicer for the payment of any accrued and unpaid Aggregate Unpaids or for a Reinvestment as provided in this Section&nbsp;2.2. If at any time any Collections are
received by the Servicer prior to the Facility Termination Date, Seller hereby requests and Blue Ridge hereby agrees to make, simultaneously with such receipt, a reinvestment (each, a </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Reinvestment"  </I></B></FONT><FONT
SIZE=2>) with Blue Ridge's Portion of the balance of each and every Collection received by the Servicer such that after giving effect to such Reinvestment, the Invested Amount of such
Receivable Interest </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=7,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="17",CHK=1021570,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LU1201A.;4',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_lu1201_1_4"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
immediately after such receipt and corresponding Reinvestment shall be equal to the amount of Invested Amount immediately prior to such receipt. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;On
each Settlement Date prior to the Facility Termination Date, the Servicer shall remit to the Agent's Account the amounts set aside during the preceding Settlement
Period that have not been subject to a Reinvestment and (after deduction of its Servicing Fee) apply such amounts (if not previously paid in accordance with Section&nbsp;2.1) to the Aggregate
Unpaids in the order specified: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>first,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> ratably to the payment of all accrued and unpaid CP Costs, Yield and Broken Funding Costs (if any) that are then due and
owing, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>second,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> ratably to the payment of all accrued and unpaid fees under the Fee Letter (if any) that are then due and owing, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>third,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> if required under Section&nbsp;1.3 or 1.4, to the ratable reduction of Aggregate Invested Amount, </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>fourth,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> for the ratable payment of all other unpaid Recourse Obligations, if any, that are then due and owing, and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>fifth,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the balance, if any, to Seller or otherwise in accordance with Seller's instructions. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;If
the Collections are insufficient to pay the Servicing Fee and the Aggregate Unpaids specified above on any Settlement Date, Seller shall make demand upon ADC Telecom
for repayment of any outstanding Demand Advances in an aggregate amount equal to the lesser of (i)&nbsp;the amount of such shortfall in Collections, and (ii)&nbsp;the aggregate outstanding
principal balance of the Demand Advances, together with all accrued and unpaid interest thereon, and ADC Telecom hereby agrees to pay such amount to the Agent's Account on such Settlement Date. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
2.3</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Repayment of Demand Advances on the Facility Termination Date; Collections.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;On
the Facility Termination Date, ADC Telecom hereby agrees to repay the aggregate outstanding principal balance of all Demand Advances, together with all accrued and
unpaid interest thereon, to the Agent's Account, without demand or notice of any kind, all of which are hereby expressly waived by ADC Telecom. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;On
the Facility Termination Date and on each day thereafter, the Servicer shall set aside and hold in trust, for the Secured Parties, all Collections received on each
such day. On and after the Facility Termination Date, the Servicer shall, on each Settlement Date and on each other Business Day specified by the Agent (after deduction of any accrued and unpaid
Servicing Fee as of such date): (i)&nbsp;remit to the Agent's Account the amounts set aside pursuant to the preceding two sentences, and (ii)&nbsp;apply such amounts to reduce the Aggregate
Unpaids as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>first,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> to the reimbursement of the Agent's costs of collection and enforcement of this Agreement, </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>second,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> ratably to the payment of all accrued and unpaid CP Costs, Yield and Broken Funding Costs, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>third,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> ratably to the payment of all accrued and unpaid fees under the Fee Letter, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>fourth,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> to the ratable reduction of Aggregate Invested Amount, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>fifth,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> for the ratable payment of all other Aggregate Unpaids, and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>sixth,  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> after the Final Payout Date, to Seller. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=8,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="17",CHK=142273,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LU1201A.;4',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_lu1201_1_5"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
2.4</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payment Recission.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No payment of any of the Aggregate Unpaids shall be considered paid or applied
hereunder to the extent that, at any time, all or any portion of such payment or application is rescinded by application of law or judicial authority, or must otherwise be returned or refunded for any
reason. Seller shall remain obligated for the amount of any payment or application so rescinded, returned or refunded, and shall promptly pay to the Agent (for application to the Person or Persons who
suffered such recission, return or refund) the full amount thereof, plus interest thereon at the Default Rate from the date of any such recission, return or refunding. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
2.5</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Clean Up Call.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to Seller's rights pursuant to Section&nbsp;1.3, Seller shall have the
right (after providing written notice to the Agent in accordance with the Required Notice Period), at any time following the reduction of the Aggregate Invested Amount to a level that is less than
10.0% of the original Purchase Limit, to repurchase all, but not less than all, of the then outstanding Receivable Interests. The purchase price in respect thereof shall be an amount equal to the
Aggregate Unpaids through the date of such repurchase, payable in immediately available funds to the Agent's Account. Such repurchase shall be without representation, warranty or recourse of any kind
by, on the part of, or against Blue Ridge or the Agent. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lu1201_article_iii._commercial_paper_funding"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lu1201_5"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE III.    <BR>    <BR>    COMMERCIAL PAPER FUNDING    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
3.1</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CP Costs.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Seller shall pay CP Costs with respect to the Invested Amount of all Receivable Interests
funded through the issuance of Commercial Paper. Each Receivable Interest that is funded substantially with Pooled Commercial Paper will accrue CP Costs each day on a pro rata basis, based upon the
percentage share that the Invested Amount in respect of such Receivable Interest represents in relation to all assets held by Blue Ridge and funded substantially with related Pooled Commercial Paper. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
3.2</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Calculation of CP Costs.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Not later than the 3<SUP>rd</SUP> Business Day immediately preceding
each Monthly Reporting Date, Blue Ridge shall calculate the aggregate amount of CP Costs applicable to its Receivable Interests for the Calculation Period then most recently ended and shall notify
Seller of such aggregate amount. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
3.3</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CP Costs Payments.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On each Settlement Date, Seller shall pay to the Agent (for the benefit of Blue
Ridge) an aggregate amount equal to all accrued and unpaid CP Costs in respect of the Invested Amount of all Receivable Interests funded with Commercial Paper for the Calculation Period then most
recently ended in accordance with Article&nbsp;II. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
3.4</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Default Rate.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;From and after the occurrence of an Amortization Event, all Receivable Interests shall
accrue Yield at the Default Rate. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lu1201_article_iv._liquidity_fundings"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lu1201_6"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE IV.    <BR>    <BR>    LIQUIDITY FUNDINGS    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
4.1</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Liquidity Fundings.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior to the occurrence of an Amortization Event, the outstanding Invested
Amount of each Receivable Interest funded with a Liquidity Funding shall accrue Yield for each day during its Interest Period at either the LIBO Rate or the Alternate Base Rate in accordance
with the terms and conditions hereof. Until Seller gives the required notice to the Agent of another Yield Rate in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.4, the initial Yield Rate for any Receivable
Interest funded with a Liquidity Funding shall be the Alternate Base Rate (unless the Default Rate is then applicable). If any undivided interest in a Receivable Interest initially funded with
Commercial Paper is sold to the Liquidity Banks pursuant to this Agreement and the Liquidity Agreement, such undivided interest in such Receivable Interest shall be deemed to have a Interest Period
commencing on the date of such sale. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=9,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="17",CHK=940480,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LU1201B.;4',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_lu1201_1_6"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
4.2</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Yield Payments.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On the Settlement Date for each Receivable Interest that is funded with a Liquidity
Funding, Seller shall pay to the Agent (for the benefit of the Liquidity Banks) an aggregate amount equal to the accrued and unpaid Yield thereon for the entire Interest Period of each such Liquidity
Funding ending on such Settlement Date in accordance with Article&nbsp;II. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
4.3</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selection and Continuation of Interest Periods.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;With
consultation from (and approval by) the Agent, Seller shall from time to time request Interest Periods for the Receivable Interests funded with Liquidity Fundings, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided that  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> if at any time
any Liquidity Funding is outstanding, Seller shall always request Interest Periods such that at least one Interest Period shall end on the date specified in
clause&nbsp;(A) of the definition of Settlement Date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;Seller
or the Agent, upon notice to and consent by the other received at least three (3)&nbsp;Business Days prior to the end of a Interest Period (the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Terminating Tranche"  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) for any Liquidity Funding,
may, effective on the last day of the Terminating Tranche: (i)&nbsp;divide any such Liquidity Funding into multiple Liquidity Fundings,
(ii)&nbsp;combine any such Liquidity Funding with one or more other Liquidity Fundings that have a Terminating Tranche ending on the same day as such Terminating Tranche or (iii)&nbsp;combine any
such Liquidity Funding with a new Liquidity Funding to be made by the Liquidity Banks on the day such Terminating Tranche ends. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
4.4</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Liquidity Funding Yield Rates.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Seller may select the LIBO Rate (subject to Section&nbsp;4.5 below)
or the Alternate Base Rate for each Liquidity Funding. Seller shall by 12:00 noon (New York time): (i)&nbsp;at least three (3)&nbsp;Business Days prior to the expiration of any Terminating Tranche
with respect to which the LIBO Rate is being requested as a new Yield Rate and (ii)&nbsp;at least one (1)&nbsp;Business Day prior to the expiration of any Terminating Tranche with respect to which
the Alternate Base Rate is being requested as a new Yield Rate, give the Agent irrevocable notice of the new Yield Rate for the Liquidity Funding associated with such Terminating Tranche. Until Seller
gives notice to the Agent of another Yield Rate, the initial Yield Rate for any Receivable Interest assigned or participated to the
Liquidity Banks pursuant to the Liquidity Agreement shall be the Alternate Base Rate (unless the Default Rate is then applicable). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
4.5</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Suspension of the LIBO Rate.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;If
any Liquidity Bank notifies the Agent that it has determined that funding its ratable share of the Liquidity Fundings at a LIBO Rate would violate any applicable law,
rule, regulation, or directive of any governmental or regulatory authority, whether or not having the force of law, or that (i)&nbsp;deposits of a type and maturity appropriate to match fund its
Liquidity Funding at such LIBO Rate are not available or (ii)&nbsp;such LIBO Rate does not accurately reflect the cost of acquiring or maintaining a Liquidity Funding at such LIBO Rate, then the
Agent shall suspend the availability of such LIBO Rate and require Seller to select the Alternate Base Rate for any Liquidity Funding accruing Yield at such LIBO Rate. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;If
less than all of the Liquidity Banks give a notice to the Agent pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.5(a), each Liquidity Bank which gave such a notice shall be obliged, at
the request of Seller, Blue Ridge or the Agent, to assign all of its rights and obligations hereunder to (i)&nbsp;another Liquidity Bank or (ii)&nbsp;another funding entity nominated by Seller or
the Agent that is an Eligible Assignee willing to participate in the Liquidity Agreement through the Liquidity Termination Date in the place of such notifying Liquidity Bank; </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B><I>provided that  </I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
(i)&nbsp;the notifying Liquidity Bank receives payment in full of all Aggregate Unpaids owing to it (whether due or accrued), and (ii)&nbsp;the replacement Liquidity Bank
otherwise satisfies the requirements of the Liquidity Agreement. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
4.6</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Default Rate.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;From and after the occurrence of an Amortization Event, all Liquidity Fundings shall
accrue Yield at the Default Rate. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=10,EFW="2067550",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="17",CHK=107515,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK009:[02STP1.02STP1201]LU1201B.;4',USER='PBELANG',CD='16-JAN-2002;01:46' -->
<A NAME="page_lu1201_1_7"> </A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lu1201_article_v._representations_and_warranties"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lu1201_7"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE V.    <BR>    <BR>    REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
5.1</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Representations and Warranties of the Seller Parties.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Seller Party hereby represents and
warrants to the Agent and Blue Ridge, as to itself, as of the date hereof and as of the date of each Incremental Purchase and the date of each Reinvestment that: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Existence and Power.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Such Seller Party's jurisdiction of organization is correctly set forth in the preamble
to this Agreement. Such Seller Party is duly organized under the laws of that jurisdiction and no other state or jurisdiction, and such jurisdiction must maintain a public record showing the
organization to have been organized. Such Seller Party is validly existing and in good standing under the laws of its state of organization. Such Seller Party is duly qualified to do business and is
in good standing as a foreign entity, and has and holds all organizational power and all governmental licenses, authorizations, consents and approvals required to carry on its business in each
jurisdiction in which its business is conducted except where the failure to so qualify or so hold could not reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Power and Authority; Due Authorization, Execution and Delivery.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The execution and delivery by such Seller
Party of this Agreement and each other Transaction Document to which it is a party, and the performance of its obligations hereunder and thereunder and, in the case of Seller, Seller's use of the
proceeds of Purchases made hereunder, are within its corporate powers and authority and have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action on its part. This Agreement and each other
Transaction Document to which such Seller Party is a party has been duly executed and delivered by such Seller Party. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No Conflict.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The execution and delivery by such Seller Party of this Agreement and each other Transaction
Document to which it is a party, and the performance of its obligations hereunder and thereunder do not contravene or violate (i)&nbsp;its certificate or articles of incorporation or
by-laws, (ii)&nbsp;any law, rule or regulation applicable to it, (iii)&nbsp;any restrictions under any agreement, contract or instrument to which it is a party or by which it or any of
its property is bound, or (iv)&nbsp;any order, writ, judgment, award, injunction or decree binding on or affecting it or its property, and do not result in the creation or imposition of any Adverse
Claim on assets of such Seller Party or its Subsidiaries (except as created hereunder) except, in any case, where such contravention or violation could not reasonably be expected to have a Material
Adverse Effect; and no transaction contemplated hereby requires compliance with any bulk sales act or similar law. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Governmental Authorization.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other than the filing of the financing statements required hereunder, no
authorization or approval or other action by, and no notice to or filing with, any governmental authority or regulatory body is required for the due execution and delivery by such Seller Party of this
Agreement and each other Transaction Document to which it is a party and the performance of its obligations hereunder and thereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Actions, Suits.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There are no actions, suits or proceedings pending, or to the best of such Seller Party's
knowledge, threatened, against or affecting such Seller Party, or any of its properties, in or before any court, arbitrator or other body, that could reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse
Effect. Such Seller Party is not in default with respect to any order of any court, arbitrator or governmental
body; provided that, with respect to each Seller Party that is not the Seller, such default could reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Binding Effect.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement and each other Transaction Document to which such Seller Party is a party
constitute the legal, valid and binding obligations of such Seller Party enforceable against such Seller Party in accordance with their respective terms, except as such enforcement may be limited by
applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization or other similar </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)</FONT><FONT

to the Agent or Blue Ridge for purposes of or in connection with this Agreement, any of the other Transaction Documents or any transaction contemplated hereby or thereby is, and all such information
hereafter furnished by such Seller Party or any of its Affiliates to the Agent or Blue Ridge will be, true and accurate in every material respect on the date such information is stated or certified
and does not and will not contain any material misstatement of fact or omit to state a material fact or any fact necessary to make the statements contained therein not misleading. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)</FONT><FONT

(A)&nbsp;Section&nbsp;7.2(e) of this Agreement or (B)&nbsp;Regulation&nbsp;T, U or X promulgated by the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System from time to time or (ii)&nbsp;to
acquire any security in any transaction which is subject to Section&nbsp;12, 13 or 14 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Good Title.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Seller is the legal and beneficial owner of the Receivables and Related Security with respect
thereto, free and clear of any Adverse Claim, except as created by the Transaction Documents. There have been duly filed all financing statements or other similar instruments or documents necessary
under the UCC (or any comparable law) of all appropriate jurisdictions to perfect Seller's ownership interest in each Receivable, its Collections and the Related Security. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(j)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Perfection.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement is effective to create a valid security interest in favor of the Agent for the
benefit of the Secured Parties in the Purchased Assets to secure payment of the Aggregate Unpaids, free and clear of any Adverse Claim except as created by the Transactions Documents. There have been
duly filed all financing statements or other similar instruments or documents necessary under the UCC (or any comparable law) of all appropriate jurisdictions to perfect the Agent's (on behalf of the
Secured Parties) security interest in the Purchased Assets. Such Seller Party's jurisdiction of organization is a jurisdiction whose law generally requires information concerning the existence of a
nonpossessory security interest to be made generally available in a filing, record or registration system as a condition or result of such a security interest's obtaining priority over the rights of a
lien creditor which respect to collateral. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(k)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Places of Business and Locations of Records.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The principal places of business and chief executive office of
such Seller Party and the offices where it keeps all of its Records are located at the address(es) listed on Exhibit&nbsp;III or such other locations of which the Agent has been notified in
accordance with Section&nbsp;7.2(a) in jurisdictions where all action required by Section&nbsp;13.3(a) has been taken and completed. Seller's Federal Employer Identification Number or
organizational number is correctly set forth on Exhibit&nbsp;III. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(l)</FONT><FONT

at all times been satisfied and duly performed. The names, addresses and jurisdictions of organization of all Collection Banks, together with the account numbers of the Collection Accounts of Seller
at each Collection Bank and the post office box number of each Lock-Box, are listed on Exhibit&nbsp;IV. Seller has not granted any Person, other than the Agent as contemplated by this
Agreement, dominion and control of any Lock-Box or Collection Account, or the right to take dominion and control of any such Lock-Box or Collection Account at a future time or
upon the occurrence of a future event. </FONT></P>

stock of Seller, free and clear of any Adverse Claim. Such capital stock is validly issued, fully paid and nonassessable, and there are no options, warrants or other rights to acquire securities of
Seller. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(p)</FONT><FONT

"subsidiary holding company" of a "holding company" within the meaning of the Public Utility Holding Company Act of 1935, as amended, or any successor statute. Such Seller Party is not an "investment
company" within the meaning of the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended, or any successor statute. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(q)</FONT><FONT

regulations, orders, writs, judgments, injunctions, decrees or awards to which it may be subject, except where the failure to so comply could not reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse
Effect. Each Receivable, together with the Contract related thereto, does not contravene any laws, rules or regulations applicable thereto (including, without limitation, laws, rules and regulations
relating to truth in lending, fair credit billing, fair credit reporting, equal credit opportunity, fair debt collection practices and privacy), and no part of such Contract is in violation of any
such law, rule or regulation, except where such contravention or violation could not reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(r)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compliance with Credit and Collection Policy.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Such Seller Party has complied in all material respects with
the Credit and Collection Policy with regard to each Receivable and the related Contract, and has not made any material adverse change to such Credit and Collection Policy, except such material
adverse changes as to which the Agent has been notified in accordance with Section&nbsp;7.1(a)(vii)&nbsp;and have given its prior written consent. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(s)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payments to Applicable Originator.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With respect to each Receivable transferred to Seller under a Receivables
Sale Agreement, Seller has given reasonably equivalent value to the applicable Originator in consideration therefor and such transfer was not made for or on account of an antecedent debt. No transfer
by any Originator of any Receivable under a Receivables Sale Agreement is or may be voidable under any section of the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1978 (11 U.S.C. &sect;&sect; 101 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>et seq.  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), as amended.
</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(t)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Enforceability of Contracts.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Contract with respect to each Receivable is effective to create, and has
created, a legal, valid and binding obligation of the related Obligor to pay the Outstanding Balance of the Receivable created thereunder and any accrued interest thereon, enforceable against the
Obligor in accordance with its terms, except as such enforcement may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization or other similar laws relating to or limiting creditors' rights
generally and by general principles of equity (regardless of whether enforcement is sought in a proceeding in equity or at law). </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lv1201_article_vi._conditions_of_purchases"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lv1201_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VI.    <BR>    <BR>    CONDITIONS OF PURCHASES    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
6.1</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conditions Precedent to Initial Incremental Purchase.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The initial Incremental Purchase of a
Receivable Interest under this Agreement is subject to the conditions precedent that (a)&nbsp;the Agent shall have received on or before the date of such Purchase those documents listed on
Schedule&nbsp;A and (b)&nbsp;the Agent shall have received all fees and expenses required to be paid on such date pursuant to the terms of this Agreement and the Fee Letter; provided that the
execution of this Agreement by the parties hereto shall not be deemed a waiver of any of the conditions precedent to the initial Incremental Purchase of a Receivable Interest under this Agreement in
any way. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section
6.2</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conditions Precedent to All Purchases and Reinvestments.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Incremental Purchase and each
Reinvestment shall be subject to the further conditions precedent that (a)&nbsp;in the case of each such Purchase: (i)&nbsp;the Servicer shall have delivered to the Agent on or prior to the date
of such Purchase, in form and substance satisfactory to the Agent, all Monthly Reports as and when due under Section&nbsp;8.5 and (ii)&nbsp;upon the Agent's request, the Servicer shall have
delivered to the Agent at least three (3)&nbsp;days prior to such Purchase an interim Monthly Report showing the amount of Eligible Receivables; (b)&nbsp;the Agent shall have received such other
approvals, opinions or documents as it may reasonably request
and (c)&nbsp;on each Purchase Date, the following statements shall be true (and acceptance of the proceeds of such Incremental Purchase or Reinvestment shall be deemed a representation and warranty
by Seller that such statements are then true): </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
representations and warranties set forth in Section&nbsp;5.1 are true and correct on and as of the date of such Incremental Purchase or Reinvestment as though
made on and as of such Purchase Date; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;no
event has occurred and is continuing, or would result from such Incremental Purchase or Reinvestment, that will constitute an Amortization Event, and no event has
occurred and is continuing, or would result from such Incremental Purchase or Reinvestment, that would constitute an Unmatured Amortization Event; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Aggregate Invested Amount does not exceed the Purchase Limit and the aggregate Receivable Interests do not exceed 100%. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>It
is expressly understood that each Reinvestment shall, unless otherwise directed by the Agent or Blue Ridge, occur automatically on each day that the Servicer shall receive any Collections without
the requirement that any further action be taken on the part of any Person and notwithstanding the failure of Seller to satisfy any of the foregoing conditions precedent in respect of such
Reinvestment. The failure of Seller to satisfy any of the foregoing conditions precedent in respect of any Reinvestment shall give rise to a right of the Agent, which right may be exercised at any
time on demand of the Agent, to rescind the related purchase and direct Seller to pay to the Agent's Account, for the benefit </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>10</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
